definition.zh: 油炸的（全浸没热油烹调的）

examples.en: Deep-fry food can be tasty but heavy.
examples.zh: 油炸食物好吃，但可能比较油腻。

examples.en: He avoids deep-fry snacks and chooses grilled food instead.
examples.zh: 他避开油炸零食，改选烤制食物。

extraExplanation: “Deep-fry”通常指“全浸没油炸”，区别于“pan-fry（平底锅少油煎）”和“shallow-fry（浅油炸）”。
在英语菜单里，deep-fried常见于美式餐饮（如deep-fried chicken、deep-fried mozzarella sticks）。家用烹饪中也常与“temperature（油温）”“batches（分批）”“crispy（酥脆）”等词搭配。

summary.en: Deep-frying is cooking food by fully submerging it in hot oil; it can also mean the act of cooking that way.
summary.zh: deep-frying 指把食物完全浸入热油中炸熟（油炸）；也可指“进行油炸”这一行为。

definition.en: a cooking method that cooks food by fully submerging it in hot oil until crisp and browned
definition.zh: （烹饪法）油炸：把食物完全浸入热油中炸至金黄酥脆

examples.en: Deep-frying makes the outside crispy while keeping the inside tender.
examples.zh: 油炸会让外皮酥脆，同时保持内部嫩滑。

examples.en: They deep-fried the chicken until it turned golden brown.
examples.zh: 他们把鸡肉油炸到金黄色。

examples.en: Deep-frying is common in fast food, but it can be heavy if eaten too often.
examples.zh: 油炸在快餐中很常见，但吃太频繁会觉得油腻。

definition.en: to cook (food) by submerging it in hot oil
definition.zh: （动词）油炸：将（食物）浸入热油中烹调

examples.en: Deep-fry the potatoes for 3–4 minutes, then drain them on paper towels.
examples.zh: 把土豆油炸3–4分钟，然后放在厨房纸上沥油。

examples.en: Don’t deep-fry when the oil isn’t hot enough, or the food will absorb too much oil.
examples.zh: 油温不够时不要油炸，否则食物会吸太多油。

extraExplanation: “Deep-frying”通常用连字符作形容词放在名词前：deep-frying oil（油炸用油）、deep-frying temperature（油炸温度）。不用连字符时更像名词/动名词：Deep frying is popular.（油炸很受欢迎。）
与之相关的常见说法：shallow-fry（浅煎/少油煎炸，油不没过食物）、pan-fry（平底锅煎）、stir-fry（炒）。在菜谱里常见的搭配动词还有：heat the oil（热油）、fry in batches（分批炸）、drain（沥油）。

summary.en: “deep-lake / deep lake” refers to a very deep lake; with a hyphen it often works as an adjective before a noun.
summary.zh: “deep-lake / deep lake”指“很深的湖”；加连字符时常作定语，放在名词前使用。

definition.en: a lake that is very deep (has a large distance from the surface to the bottom)
definition.zh: 深湖；水很深的湖（从水面到湖底的距离很大）

examples.en: This deep lake stays cold even in summer.
examples.zh: 这个深湖即使在夏天也很冷。

examples.en: People should be careful swimming in a deep lake.
examples.zh: 在深湖里游泳要小心。

definition.en: used before a noun to describe something connected with a very deep lake
definition.zh: （作定语）用于名词前，表示“与深湖相关的”

examples.en: Deep-lake currents can move nutrients around.
examples.zh: 深湖的水流可以把养分带到各处。

examples.en: They study deep-lake fish that live far below the surface.
examples.zh: 他们研究生活在水面下很深处的深湖鱼类。

extraExplanation: “deep lake”作名词短语时通常不加连字符：a deep lake。放在名词前作定语时，英语常用连字符更清楚：deep-lake water / deep-lake fish。
如果写作“Deep Lake”，可能是地名（专有名词），需要根据具体语境判断。

summary.en: Deep-ocean describes or refers to the very deep, dark parts of the ocean far below the surface.
summary.zh: deep-ocean指（或形容）远离海面、光线难以到达的海洋深处（深海）。

definition.en: Relating to the very deep parts of the ocean, far below the surface where sunlight does not reach.
definition.zh: 与深海（远离海面、几乎没有阳光的海洋深处）有关的。

examples.en: Deep-ocean currents help move heat around the planet.
examples.zh: 深海洋流帮助把热量在地球上重新分配。

examples.en: Scientists use special robots to explore deep-ocean habitats.
examples.zh: 科学家用特殊的机器人探索深海栖息地。

definition.en: The deep part of the ocean itself (used as a noun phrase in science writing).
definition.zh: 深海区域；海洋深处（在科学语境中可作名词短语使用）。

examples.en: Plastic has been found even in the deep-ocean.
examples.zh: 即使在深海也发现了塑料。

examples.en: Life in the deep-ocean often depends on chemical energy, not sunlight.
examples.zh: 深海中的生命往往依靠化学能，而不是阳光。

extraExplanation: “deep-ocean”常见于科学与环保话题，强调“远离海面、环境极端”的海域。常与ocean floor（海底）、deep sea（深海）、abyssal zone（深渊带）等概念相关。
在更日常的英语里，人们更常说deep sea或the deep ocean；带连字符的deep-ocean多用于作定语（如deep-ocean currents）。

summary.en: wealthy and able to spend a lot
summary.zh: 有钱且花得起大钱的

definition.en: Having a lot of money; wealthy and able to spend large amounts.
definition.zh: 很有钱的；财力雄厚、花得起大钱的。

examples.en: The museum depends on deep-pocketed donors to fund new exhibitions.
examples.zh: 这家博物馆依靠财力雄厚的捐赠者来资助新展览。

examples.en: They found a deep-pocketed investor to support the startup.
examples.zh: 他们找到了一位财力雄厚的投资人来支持这家初创公司。

examples.en: Small shops struggled to compete with deep-pocketed rivals.
examples.zh: 小店很难与资金雄厚的竞争对手抗衡。

extraExplanation: 语体与用法：多用于新闻、商业和公共事务语境（donor/investor/backer/rival 等名词前）。带一点“有财力优势”的色彩，但不一定是贬义。
连字符：作定语放在名词前通常写作 deep-pocketed（a deep-pocketed sponsor）；作表语也常见（The sponsor is deep-pocketed）。
etymology: 字面意思是“口袋很深”，引申为“钱多、资金充足”。常用来形容个人、公司或团体有强大财力，尤其能在投资、捐赠、竞争中出手阔绰。
mnemonic: 联想记忆：pocket=口袋，deep-pocketed=口袋很深→里面装了很多钱→“财力雄厚”。
中文联想：想成“深口袋=深不见底的钱包”。

summary.en: Deep-redly means “in a deep red color,” a rare, literary-style adverb.
summary.zh: deep-redly 表示“呈深红色地”，较少见，偏文学化用法。

definition.en: In a deep red color; in a way that looks strongly dark red (often describing how something appears or is colored).
definition.zh: 呈深红色地；以深红（暗红）的方式（常用于描述外观或着色效果）。

examples.en: The leaves were deep-redly tinted at the edges in late autumn.
examples.zh: 深秋时叶缘被染得深红。

examples.en: Her cheeks flushed deep-redly after running in the cold.
examples.zh: 她在寒冷中跑完后，脸颊泛起深红。

examples.en: The sky glowed deep-redly just before the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨前天空泛着深红的光。

extraExplanation: “deep-redly”非常少见，更自然的表达通常是：“deep red”（形容词）或“a deep red color”（名词短语）。例如：The leaves were deep red. / The sky glowed a deep red.
这个词多见于较文学化或刻意的描写中，通过把“deep red”变成副词来强调“呈现/发光/染上”的方式。日常写作里用“deeply red”或“dark red”更常见。
连字符（deep-redly）常用于临时组合的描写性用法（creative/poetic compounds），表示把“deep red”当作一个整体来修饰。

summary.en: Deep-rooted describes beliefs, feelings, traditions, or problems that have existed for a long time and are hard to change.
summary.zh: deep-rooted 指（信念、情感、传统或问题）存在已久、影响深、难以改变的“根深蒂固”。

definition.en: Strongly established for a long time and difficult to change.
definition.zh: 根深蒂固的；由来已久且难以改变的。

examples.en: There is a deep-rooted belief that hard work leads to success.
examples.zh: 人们普遍有一种根深蒂固的信念：努力工作就会成功。

examples.en: The conflict comes from deep-rooted historical tensions.
examples.zh: 这场冲突源于根深蒂固的历史矛盾。

examples.en: She has a deep-rooted fear of flying.
examples.zh: 她对坐飞机有根深蒂固的恐惧。

extraExplanation: 这个词是比喻用法：像树根扎得很深一样，表示“观念/习惯/问题”在心里或社会里存在很久、影响很大，所以不容易改变。常搭配：deep-rooted prejudice（根深蒂固的偏见）、deep-rooted tradition（根深蒂固的传统）、deep-rooted problem（积弊）。
语体上偏正式，常用于新闻、学术写作或严肃讨论。若想更口语，可以用 long-standing（长期存在的）或 ingrained（根深蒂固的/习惯成自然的）。

summary.en: Deep-rootedness means the state of being firmly established and difficult to change.
summary.zh: deep-rootedness 指“根深蒂固、不易改变的状态或性质”。

definition.en: The quality of being firmly established and hard to change (in beliefs, habits, traditions, or problems).
definition.zh: （信念、习惯、传统或问题）根深蒂固、不易改变的状态或性质。

examples.en: The deep-rootedness of local traditions makes the festival feel timeless.
examples.zh: 当地传统的根深蒂固让这个节日显得历久弥新。

examples.en: They struggled with the deep-rootedness of inequality in the system.
examples.zh: 他们在努力应对体制内不平等的根深蒂固。

extraExplanation: “deep-rootedness”由形容词“deep-rooted（根深蒂固的）”加名词后缀“-ness”构成，表示一种“性质/状态”。
它多用于较正式的写作（学术、新闻、评论），日常口语更常说“how deep-rooted something is（有多根深蒂固）”或直接用“deep-rooted + 名词”（如 deep-rooted prejudice/ tradition）。

summary.en: Deep-sea describes the very deep ocean and things from there.
summary.zh: deep-sea 指“深海的”，也可指来自深海的事物。

definition.en: Located in or relating to the very deep parts of the ocean, far below the surface (often where it is dark, cold, and high-pressure).
definition.zh: 位于或与深海（远离海面、通常黑暗寒冷且水压很高的海域）有关的。

examples.en: Deep-sea fish often have special eyes or glowing lights to survive in the dark.
examples.zh: 深海鱼常常有特殊的眼睛或会发光的器官，以便在黑暗中生存。

examples.en: Scientists used a robot to explore deep-sea vents.
examples.zh: 科学家用机器人探索深海热液喷口。

definition.en: Used to describe animals, plants, or objects that live in or come from the deep ocean.
definition.zh: 用于描述生活在深海或来自深海的动植物或物体。

examples.en: They found a new deep-sea coral species.
examples.zh: 他们发现了一种新的深海珊瑚物种。

examples.en: The museum displayed deep-sea specimens collected by researchers.
examples.zh: 博物馆展出了研究人员采集的深海标本。

extraExplanation: “deep sea”在海洋学里常指大约200米以下的水层（阳光很难照到），更深处可到“abyssal zone（深渊带）”。日常英语里“deep-sea”多用作形容词（deep-sea exploration/creatures/fishing）。
常见搭配：deep-sea exploration（深海探索）、deep-sea diving（深海潜水）、deep-sea fishing（深海捕捞/远洋深海钓鱼）、deep-sea trench（深海海沟）、deep-sea vent（深海热液喷口）。

summary.en: Equipment made for operating in very deep ocean conditions.
summary.zh: 用于极深海域作业的设备。

definition.en: Tools and machines designed for work far below the ocean surface, able to withstand high pressure and harsh conditions (used for diving, research, repair, or exploration).
definition.zh: 为海洋深处作业而设计的工具与设备，能承受高压和恶劣环境（用于潜水、科研、维修或探索）。

examples.en: The research team tested new deep-sea equipment before the expedition.
examples.zh: 科研团队在远征前测试了新型深海设备。

examples.en: Deep-sea equipment must be reliable because repairs are difficult underwater.
examples.zh: 深海设备必须可靠，因为水下维修很困难。

examples.en: They used deep-sea equipment to film the shipwreck at 3,000 meters.
examples.zh: 他们用深海设备拍摄了3000米深处的沉船。

extraExplanation: 常见的 deep-sea equipment 包括：ROV（水下遥控机器人）、AUV（自主水下航行器）、深海摄像机与照明、声呐、采样器、耐压舱/耐压壳体、深海潜水器相关部件等。
与 scuba gear（普通水肺装备）不同，deep-sea equipment 往往强调“深度更大、压力更高、需要耐压设计”。
etymology: 由复合形容词 deep-sea（“深海的”）+ equipment（“设备”）构成；常见于海洋工程、深海潜水与海洋科学语境。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：deep-sea=“深海”，equipment=“设备”，合起来就是“深海用的设备”。
联想中文常说的“深海装备/深海设备”，几乎一一对应，记忆成本很低。

summary.en: technology and equipment for operating or researching at great ocean depths
summary.zh: 用于大深度海洋环境作业或研究的技术与设备

definition.en: Tools, equipment, and engineering methods used to explore, operate, or conduct research in the deep ocean (especially at great depths under high pressure).
definition.zh: 用于深海（尤其是高压大深度环境）探索、作业或科研的工具、设备与工程技术。

examples.en: Deep-sea technology allows scientists to study ecosystems that never see sunlight.
examples.zh: 深海技术让科学家能够研究那些从未见过阳光的生态系统。

examples.en: The company developed deep-sea technology to inspect underwater pipelines safely.
examples.zh: 这家公司研发了深海技术，用于安全检查海底管道。

examples.en: Advances in deep-sea technology have improved mapping of the ocean floor.
examples.zh: 深海技术的进步提升了海底地形测绘能力。

extraExplanation: 常见相关设备/手段包括：ROV（水下遥控机器人）、AUV（自主水下机器人）、载人潜水器、耐压舱体材料、声呐与多波束测深、深海摄像与照明、海底采样器与传感器网络。
语境上既可指科研（海洋生物、地质、气候记录），也可指工业应用（海底电缆/管线检修、海上能源、沉船搜救）。
etymology: 由“deep-sea（深海的）+ technology（技术）”构成的复合名词短语；随着20世纪潜水器、声呐与海洋工程发展而逐渐常用。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：deep-sea=“深海”，technology=“技术”，合起来就是“深海用的技术/设备”。
联想画面：一个耐压的“深海机器人(ROV)”在黑暗海底打灯拍摄——这就是deep-sea technology。

summary.en: Deep-seated means long-lasting and hard to change, or located deep inside the body.
summary.zh: deep-seated 表示“根深蒂固、难以改变的”，也可指“位置很深的（如感染、疼痛）”。

definition.en: (Of a feeling, belief, or problem) strong and lasting, existing for a long time and difficult to change.
definition.zh: （指情感、信念或问题）根深蒂固的；由来已久且很难改变的。

examples.en: She has a deep-seated fear of flying.
examples.zh: 她对坐飞机有一种根深蒂固的恐惧。

examples.en: There is deep-seated mistrust between the two groups.
examples.zh: 这两个群体之间存在根深蒂固的不信任。

examples.en: The policy failed to address deep-seated inequality.
examples.zh: 这项政策没能解决由来已久的社会不平等。

definition.en: Located far inside; firmly fixed in place (often used in medical or physical descriptions).
definition.zh: （位置）深处的；（状态）牢固固定的（常用于医学或身体描述）。

examples.en: The doctor examined a deep-seated infection.
examples.zh: 医生检查了一个较深部位的感染。

examples.en: He felt pain from a deep-seated bruise.
examples.zh: 他感到来自深层淤伤的疼痛。

extraExplanation: “Deep-seated”是复合形容词（deep + seated），常用连字符；seated在这里不是“坐着”的意思，而是“安置在……里面/扎根于……”。
常见搭配：deep-seated fear/anger/resentment（恐惧/愤怒/怨恨），deep-seated prejudice/bias（偏见），deep-seated problem/conflict（问题/冲突）。
语体上比较正式，常见于新闻报道、学术写作或严肃讨论中。

summary.en: Deep-set describes eyes that sit far back in the sockets, and (more formally) feelings or habits that are firmly established.
summary.zh: deep-set可形容“眼睛深陷、深邃”，也可（较正式）形容“情感/习惯等根深蒂固、难以改变”。

definition.en: (Of eyes) positioned deep in the sockets, often giving a shadowed or intense look.
definition.zh: （指眼睛）深陷的；位于眼窝较深处的，常给人阴影感或深邃感。

examples.en: He had deep-set eyes that made him look serious.
examples.zh: 他有一双深陷的眼睛，让他看起来很严肃。

examples.en: In the dim light, her deep-set eyes seemed even darker.
examples.zh: 在昏暗的光线下，她深陷的眼睛显得更黑了。

definition.en: Firmly established or hard to change (used about feelings, habits, or beliefs).
definition.zh: 根深蒂固的；牢固形成、难以改变的（指情感、习惯或信念等）。

examples.en: There is deep-set distrust between the two groups.
examples.zh: 这两个群体之间存在根深蒂固的不信任。

examples.en: His deep-set habits were hard to break.
examples.zh: 他根深蒂固的习惯很难改掉。

extraExplanation: “deep-set”是复合形容词，常用连字符（hyphen）连接，尤其放在名词前：deep-set eyes。若放在系动词后，有时也可写作deep set：Her eyes are deep set。
描述外貌时，“deep-set eyes”多为中性描写，但在文学或影视中常被用来营造“深邃、阴郁、坚毅、疲惫”等气质；具体褒贬取决于语境。
第二个含义（根深蒂固的）更偏书面或正式语域，常与distrust, fear, resentment, belief, habit等词搭配。

summary.en: Deep-skinned means having dark-colored skin (a deeper skin tone).
summary.zh: deep-skinned 指“深色皮肤的、肤色较深的”。

definition.en: Having dark-colored skin; describing a person with a deeper (darker) skin tone.
definition.zh: （人）深色皮肤的；肤色较深的。

examples.en: The novel features a deep-skinned hero who challenges stereotypes.
examples.zh: 这部小说塑造了一位深肤色的男主角，挑战刻板印象。

examples.en: She chose a foundation shade that matches her deep-skinned complexion.
examples.zh: 她选择了与自己深肤色肤色相匹配的粉底色号。

examples.en: The photographer adjusted the lighting so deep-skinned models were shown accurately.
examples.zh: 摄影师调整了灯光，让深肤色模特的肤色呈现更真实。

extraExplanation: “deep-skinned”不是最常见的固定搭配，更常见的是“dark-skinned”或“brown-skinned”。在描述他人外貌时，英语中通常建议用中性、尊重的说法，并在不必要时避免强调肤色。
在谈到身份与族裔时，“Black”常用于指代群体身份（需大写），而“dark-skinned”更偏向描述肤色深浅；两者语境不同，使用时要根据对方自我认同与具体语境选择。

summary.en: Deep-sourced describes information that is thoroughly researched from primary sources, or resources taken from deep underground/underwater.
summary.zh: Deep-sourced 指“来源很深、很扎实”的一手资料/研究；也可指从地下深处或深水获得的资源。

definition.en: (especially of information, analysis, or data) gathered from original, primary, or hard-to-reach sources; very well-researched and strongly grounded.
definition.zh: （尤指信息、分析或数据）来自原始/一手或不易获得的来源；研究很深入、依据很扎实。

examples.en: The report is deep-sourced, with interviews and original documents.
examples.zh: 这份报告资料来源很深、很扎实，包含访谈和原始文件。

examples.en: We need deep-sourced evidence, not rumors from social media.
examples.zh: 我们需要有深度来源的证据，而不是社交媒体上的传言。

examples.en: Her deep-sourced analysis explains the issue beyond headlines.
examples.zh: 她的深度来源分析把问题讲得比新闻标题更透彻。

definition.en: (of materials or resources) obtained from deep underground or deep water rather than near the surface.
definition.zh: （指材料或资源）从地下深处或深水区域获取，而不是从地表/浅层获得。

examples.en: The company specializes in deep-sourced minerals.
examples.zh: 这家公司专注于开采深层矿产。

examples.en: Deep-sourced sediments can reveal ancient climate changes.
examples.zh: 深处取得的沉积物可以揭示古代气候变化。

extraExplanation: “deep-sourced”不是最常见的固定词，更多见于新闻报道、商业写作和研究语境，用来强调“来源很深、很硬核（不是二手转述）”。
写作上常用连字符作形容词（deep-sourced data / deep-sourced reporting）。如果放在名词后作表语，有时也会写作 deep sourced（如：The data is deep sourced），但连字符形式更清晰。
近义表达可根据语境选：well-researched（研究充分）、evidence-based（以证据为基础）、primary-source（基于一手资料）、grounded（有依据的）。

summary.en: Deep-space means outer space far from Earth, often used to describe missions, probes, or communication beyond Earth orbit.
summary.zh: deep-space 指远离地球的外层空间（深空），常用来描述地球轨道之外的任务、探测器或通信系统。

definition.en: The region far beyond Earth’s atmosphere, especially beyond low Earth orbit; outer space.
definition.zh: 深空：指远离地球大气层的区域，尤指低地球轨道之外的外层空间。

examples.en: The probe sent back images from deep-space.
examples.zh: 探测器从深空传回了图像。

examples.en: Deep-space missions require very reliable communication systems.
examples.zh: 深空任务需要非常可靠的通信系统。

examples.en: Scientists studied deep-space radiation to protect astronauts.
examples.zh: 科学家研究深空辐射以保护宇航员。

definition.en: Relating to travel, communication, or exploration in outer space far from Earth.
definition.zh: 深空的：与远离地球的外层空间旅行、通信或探索有关的。

examples.en: NASA upgraded its deep-space network antennas.
examples.zh: 美国航天局升级了深空网络的天线。

examples.en: They designed a deep-space engine for long journeys.
examples.zh: 他们为长途航行设计了一种深空引擎。

extraExplanation: “deep-space”常见于科技新闻与科幻作品中，写作时常作定语（deep-space mission / deep-space network）。作名词用法更常写成不加连字符的“deep space”（例如：in deep space）。
相关词：deep-space probe（深空探测器）、deep-space communication（深空通信）、deep-space navigation（深空导航）。
文学/文化语境：科幻作品里常用“deep space”营造未知、孤独与距离感，例如“lost in deep space（迷失在深空）”常用于标题或宣传语。

summary.en: Deep-stalled describes an aircraft trapped in a deep stall, where normal nose-down recovery may not work.
summary.zh: deep-stalled 指飞机被“卡在”深度失速中，常规压机头改出可能不起作用。

definition.en: (Aviation) stuck in a dangerous kind of stall where the aircraft’s nose stays high and the airflow to the tail/elevator is disturbed, making it hard or impossible to push the nose down and recover.
definition.zh: （航空）进入并“卡在”一种危险的深度失速状态：机头保持很高的仰角，机翼的乱流/尾流影响到尾翼或升降舵，导致很难甚至无法压低机头恢复飞行。

examples.en: The test pilot reported the airplane became deep-stalled during the maneuver and did not respond to normal recovery inputs.
examples.zh: 试飞员报告在该机动中飞机进入深度失速，按常规改出操作也没有反应。

examples.en: Some T-tail designs are more likely to become deep-stalled if the tailplane is blanketed by the wing’s wake.
examples.zh: 一些 T 形尾翼设计在尾翼被机翼尾流遮蔽时更容易发生深度失速。

extraExplanation: “deep stall（深度失速）”常与某些尾翼布局有关，尤其是 T 形尾翼：当机翼在大迎角下产生强烈尾流，可能“遮住”尾翼，使升降舵效果变差，机头就不容易压下来。
写作上常见两种形式：deep-stalled（形容词，描述状态）与 in a deep stall（介词短语）。也可见 deep-stall（动词，较少见，如：The aircraft deep-stalled.）。

summary.en: Deep-UV means deep ultraviolet light (short-wavelength UV), or relating to it, commonly used in tech and science.
summary.zh: deep-UV 指深紫外光（短波紫外）或与其相关的事物，常用于科技与科研语境。

definition.en: relating to the deep ultraviolet part of the light spectrum (short-wavelength UV, roughly below 300 nm), often used in science and engineering.
definition.zh: 与深紫外光有关的（紫外光中波长很短的一段，通常指约300纳米以下），常用于科学与工程领域。

examples.en: Deep-UV light can kill germs on surfaces.
examples.zh: 深紫外光可以杀死物体表面的细菌。

examples.en: The lab uses a deep-UV lamp to test how materials age under strong UV exposure.
examples.zh: 实验室用深紫外灯来测试材料在强紫外照射下的老化情况。

definition.en: deep ultraviolet light itself (the deep-UV region).
definition.zh: 深紫外光；深紫外波段（指这段光本身）。

examples.en: This sensor is sensitive to deep-UV but not to visible light.
examples.zh: 这个传感器对深紫外敏感，但对可见光不敏感。

examples.en: Deep-UV is useful for detecting certain chemicals that absorb short-wavelength UV.
examples.zh: 深紫外对检测某些会吸收短波紫外的化学物质很有用。

extraExplanation: “deep-UV”常写作“deep UV”或缩写“DUV”。在半导体光刻中，“DUV lithography（深紫外光刻）”通常指使用约248 nm（KrF）或193 nm（ArF）激光的技术。
在消毒场景中更常听到“UVC（UVC紫外）”。其中一部分UVC属于deep-UV，但不同领域对波段边界的说法可能略有差异。
深紫外对皮肤和眼睛有伤害，谈到deep-UV设备时常会同时提到防护（shielding/eye protection）。

summary.en: “Deep-voiced” describes someone whose voice is low and deep rather than high-pitched.
summary.zh: “deep-voiced”指嗓音低沉、音调较低的人。

definition.en: Having a low, deep-sounding voice (not high-pitched).
definition.zh: （嗓音）低沉的；声音深厚的（不尖细）。

examples.en: He’s deep-voiced and easy to recognize on the phone.
examples.zh: 他的声音很低沉，在电话里很容易认出来。

examples.en: A deep-voiced narrator can make the story feel more serious.
examples.zh: 低沉的旁白声音会让故事感觉更严肃。

examples.en: She spoke in a calm, deep-voiced tone.
examples.zh: 她用平静、低沉的语气说话。

extraExplanation: “deep-voiced”通常是褒义或中性描述，常让人联想到成熟、稳重、权威或有磁性（a deep, resonant voice）。
常见搭配：deep-voiced man/singer/narrator；与“soft-spoken（说话轻声）”不同，deep-voiced强调音高低，不一定表示音量小。

summary.en: Deep-water refers to water that is very deep, and it can also describe things related to deep water. In the idiom “in deep water,” it means being in serious trouble.
summary.zh: deep-water 表示“深水（区）”，也可作定语指“与深水有关的”。短语 in deep water 表示“陷入大麻烦/困境”。

definition.en: (of the sea, a lake, a pool, etc.) water that is deep, where you cannot easily stand or touch the bottom.
definition.zh: （海、湖、泳池等的）深水区；水很深、通常无法轻易站立或踩到底的水域。

examples.en: Don’t swim in deep water unless you’re a strong swimmer.
examples.zh: 除非你很会游泳，否则不要去深水区游。

examples.en: The boat moved from shallow water into deep water.
examples.zh: 船从浅水区驶入深水区。

definition.en: (used before a noun) relating to deep water, especially activities or places in the open sea or far from shore.
definition.zh: （作定语）与深水相关的，尤指外海、离岸较远处的活动或地点。

examples.en: They planned a deep-water diving trip.
examples.zh: 他们计划了一次深水潜水之旅。

examples.en: The city is building a deep-water port to handle larger ships.
examples.zh: 这座城市正在建设深水港，以便停靠更大的船只。

definition.en: (in the phrase “in deep water”) in serious trouble or a difficult situation.
definition.zh: （用于短语“in deep water”）陷入大麻烦；处境艰难。

examples.en: He’s in deep water at work after missing the deadline.
examples.zh: 他因为错过截止日期，在工作上惹了大麻烦。

examples.en: If you lie about it, you’ll be in deep water later.
examples.zh: 如果你撒谎，之后会陷入更大的麻烦。

extraExplanation: “deep water”作名词时通常不加连字符；作形容词放在名词前时常写成“deep-water”（如deep-water diving）。
常见固定说法是“in deep water”，含义偏比喻：像掉进深水里一样难以脱身，因此表示“陷入困境/惹上麻烦”。

summary.en: Deepavali is another name for Diwali, the “Festival of Lights.”
summary.zh: Deepavali 是 Diwali（排灯节）的另一种称呼，即“灯节/光明节”。

definition.en: (Proper noun) Another name for Diwali: a major Hindu festival (also celebrated by Jains, Sikhs, and some Buddhists) known as the “Festival of Lights,” marked by lighting lamps, family gatherings, prayers, and sharing sweets.
definition.zh: （专有名词）Deepavali 是 Diwali（排灯节）的另一种说法：重要的印度宗教节日（也被耆那教、锡克教及部分佛教群体庆祝），以点灯、家庭团聚、祈福与分享甜点等活动闻名，因此常被称为“光明节/灯节”。

examples.en: In Singapore, Deepavali is a public holiday celebrated with lights, music, and food.
examples.zh: 在新加坡，Deepavali 是公共假日，人们会用灯饰、音乐和美食来庆祝。

examples.en: We visited our neighbors during Deepavali and tried homemade sweets.
examples.zh: Deepavali 期间我们去拜访了邻居，还品尝了自制甜点。

definition.en: A period or season when people celebrate Deepavali, including related events and decorations.
definition.zh: 排灯节庆祝期间（含相关活动、布置与节庆氛围）。

examples.en: Stores offer special discounts during the Deepavali season.
examples.zh: 在 Deepavali 节庆期间，商店常推出特别折扣。

extraExplanation: “Deepavali”常见于南印度语言与海外华语/英语环境（如新加坡、马来西亚），而“Diwali”在国际英语里更普遍；两者指同一节日。
词源可追溯到梵语：dīpa（灯）+ āvali（排列/一串），字面意思是“成排的灯”。
不同地区庆祝方式与日期可能略有差异，但核心意象通常与“光明战胜黑暗、善胜恶、知识胜无明”相关。

summary.en: Deepen means to become deeper or to make something more intense, serious, or developed.
summary.zh: Deepen 指（使）变深，或（使）在强度、严肃程度、理解与关系等方面“加深、深化”。

definition.en: to become deeper or make something deeper (in depth, intensity, or seriousness)
definition.zh: （使）变深；（使）加深（深度、强度或严肃程度）

examples.en: The river deepened after the heavy rain.
examples.zh: 暴雨过后，河水变深了。

examples.en: She wants to deepen her understanding of American history.
examples.zh: 她想加深对美国历史的理解。

examples.en: The news deepened his worry.
examples.zh: 这个消息加重了他的担忧。

definition.en: to develop something further over time, especially a relationship, skill, or interest
definition.zh: 进一步发展（尤指关系、技能或兴趣）；加深（联系）

examples.en: They met weekly to deepen their friendship.
examples.zh: 他们每周见面一次，以加深友谊。

examples.en: Practice will deepen your confidence in speaking English.
examples.zh: 练习会加深你说英语的自信。

extraExplanation: “deepen”既可用于具体的“深度”（如河水、颜色、声音），也常用于抽象的“程度/情感/理解”（如理解、关系、担忧）。在学习写作中，常见搭配有：deepen understanding（加深理解）、deepen relationship（加深关系）、deepen interest（加深兴趣）、deepen awareness（提高/加深意识）、deepen concern（加重担忧）。
词形上，“deep + -en”表示“使变成……/变得更……”，类似的还有：widen（变宽）、strengthen（加强）、shorten（缩短）。

word: deepen cooperation across the upstream, mid-stream and downstream industrial chains

summary.en: strengthen collaboration across all stages of the supply/value chain
summary.zh: 加强全产业链/全供应链各环节协作

definition.en: to strengthen and expand collaboration among all stages of a supply chain/value chain—from raw materials and key inputs (upstream), through processing/manufacturing (midstream), to distribution, sales, and end users (downstream)
definition.zh: 加强并拓展产业链/供应链各环节的协作——从上游（原材料与关键投入），到中游（加工/制造），再到下游（分销、销售与终端用户）

examples.en: The company plans to deepen cooperation across the upstream, mid-stream, and downstream industrial chains to reduce costs and speed up delivery.
examples.zh: 该公司计划深化产业链上游、中游、下游的协作，以降低成本并加快交付。

examples.en: By sharing data with suppliers and distributors, they deepened cooperation across the upstream, mid-stream, and downstream industrial chains.
examples.zh: 通过与供应商和经销商共享数据，他们深化了产业链上中下游的合作。

phonetic: ˈdipən koʊˌɑpəˈreɪʃən əˈkrɔs ði ˈʌpˌstrim ˈmɪdˌstrim ænd ˈdaʊnˌstrim ɪnˈdʌstriəl tʃeɪnz
extraExplanation: “Industrial chain（产业链）”在中文政策与产业报道中非常常见，英语里更接近“value chain（价值链）/ supply chain（供应链）”。在国际商务沟通中，如果强调端到端协同与交付，常用“across the value chain/supply chain”；如果强调产业配套与上下游企业关系，也可以用“industrial chain”，但需注意听众是否熟悉该表达。
书面表达中更常见的拼写是“midstream”（通常不加连字符）；“mid-stream”也能理解，但在商业英语里略少见。
etymology: “Upstream / midstream / downstream”本义来自河流的“上游/中游/下游”。在经济与产业语境中被引申为价值链不同环节；该分法在能源（如石油天然气）和制造业供应链讨论中尤为常见。“Deepen cooperation”是商务英语中的固定搭配，表示“把合作做得更深入、更紧密”。
mnemonic: 把产业链想成一条河：上游提供“源头”原料，中游把水“加工”成可用资源，下游把水送到“用户”；“across”就是把整条河都连起来合作。
记搭配：deep（深）→ deepen（加深）+ cooperation（合作）=“深化合作”。

summary.en: to strengthen and expand joint talks and actions against terrorism
summary.zh: 加强并扩大反恐方面的磋商与协作

definition.en: to strengthen and expand discussions and practical joint work to prevent and respond to terrorism
definition.zh: 加深反恐磋商与合作（加强并扩大就反恐的沟通协调与实际协作）

examples.en: The two sides agreed to deepen counter-terrorism consultation and cooperation through regular meetings and information sharing.
examples.zh: 双方同意通过定期会议和信息共享，加深反恐磋商与合作。

examples.en: The statement calls on regional partners to deepen counter-terrorism consultation and cooperation to address cross-border threats.
examples.zh: 声明呼吁地区伙伴加深反恐磋商与合作，以应对跨境威胁。

extraExplanation: 语体特点：非常正式、偏政策文件/新闻通稿用语；日常口语里更常说“work more closely on counter-terrorism”或“step up counter-terrorism cooperation”。
搭配提示：常与“regular dialogues/meetings（定期对话/会议）”“intelligence sharing（情报共享）”“joint exercises（联合演训）”“capacity building（能力建设）”等连用。
etymology: “deepen”来自“deep + -en”（使……更深/更强）；“counter-terrorism”由“counter-（反对）+ terrorism（恐怖主义）”构成；“consultation”指“磋商/咨询”；“cooperation”指“合作”。这一整句常见于外交、公报和政策文件中，用来表达“进一步加强协作”的正式说法。
mnemonic: deepen=“加深”：把关系/合作“往深里走”。看到“-en”常表示“使……变得……”，如 strengthen（使更强）。
consultation≈“磋商”：联想中文“咨询/协商”；cooperation=“共同运作/配合”（co- = 一起）。

summary.en: to build stronger shared understanding
summary.zh: 增进彼此理解

definition.en: to improve shared comprehension between two people or groups, often by talking openly, listening carefully, and learning each other’s views
definition.zh: 增进彼此的理解（通常通过沟通、倾听与了解对方观点）

examples.en: Regular check-ins can deepen mutual understanding between managers and employees.
examples.zh: 定期沟通能增进管理者与员工之间的相互理解。

examples.en: Cultural exchange programs help students deepen mutual understanding across countries.
examples.zh: 文化交流项目能帮助学生增进国家之间的相互理解。

examples.en: We asked questions instead of arguing to deepen mutual understanding.
examples.zh: 我们选择提问而不是争辩，以增进彼此的理解。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：deepen mutual understanding between A and B（增进A与B之间的相互理解）；deepen mutual understanding of…（加深对……的共同理解）。
语气偏正式、建设性，常用于会议纪要、合作声明、学校/社区项目介绍等。更口语时可用：understand each other better（更了解彼此）。
etymology: 这是由三个常见词组成的固定搭配：deepen（使更深、加强）+ mutual（相互的、共同的）+ understanding（理解）。常用于较正式的语境，如教育、职场协作与外交交流中，强调“共同的理解”在程度上被进一步加强。
mnemonic: 把它拆成三段记：deepen=“加深”，mutual=“互相”，understanding=“理解”→“加深互相理解”。
联想中文常用表达“增进理解/加深了解”，对应英文里常用deepen来表达“程度更深”。

summary.en: make someone understand something better and more fully
summary.zh: 使某人对某事理解得更深入、更透彻

definition.en: to help someone understand something more fully and clearly; to make their knowledge more detailed or mature
definition.zh: 加深某人对某事的理解；使理解更全面、更深入

examples.en: Reading primary sources can deepen students’ understanding of history.
examples.zh: 阅读第一手资料可以加深学生对历史的理解。

examples.en: The workshop was designed to deepen our understanding of workplace communication.
examples.zh: 这次工作坊旨在加深我们对职场沟通的理解。

examples.en: Travel often deepens a person’s understanding of other cultures.
examples.zh: 旅行常常会加深一个人对其他文化的理解。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：deepen one’s understanding of… / deepen understanding about…（of 更常见、更自然）。
语气偏正式，常见于学术写作、培训、报告、演讲等。口语里也可用更简单的 say：help someone understand… better。
注意 sb.’s = someone’s（某人的）。sth. = something（某事/某物）。可替换：deepen their understanding of…
etymology: deepen 来自 deep（深的）+ -en（使变得……的动词后缀），字面意思是“使更深”。在抽象意义上常用于“理解、认识、关系”等变得更深刻。
mnemonic: 把 deep（深）+ en（使）记成“使……更深”→“理解更深”。
联想中文“加深理解”：加深=deepen，理解=understanding，结构几乎一一对应，容易套用。

word: deepen the reform of arts and performing groups

summary.en: make reforms in arts organizations more thorough and far-reaching
summary.zh: 把对文艺/演出团体的改革推进得更深入、更全面

definition.en: to carry out more thorough changes to how arts and performing groups are organized, managed, funded, and evaluated, in order to improve their quality and effectiveness
definition.zh: 进一步推进对文艺团体/演出团体的体制机制、管理方式、经费与考核等方面的改革，以提升质量与效能

examples.en: The city plans to deepen the reform of arts and performing groups by introducing clearer performance evaluations and more transparent budgets.
examples.zh: 该市计划通过引入更清晰的绩效考核和更透明的预算管理，进一步深化文艺院团改革。

examples.en: Policies were introduced to deepen the reform of arts and performing groups so they can better serve the public while remaining financially sustainable.
examples.zh: 相关政策出台，旨在深化文艺院团改革，使其更好服务公众，同时保持可持续的运转。

synonyms: further the reform of arts organizations
advance reforms in performing arts groups
push forward reforms in arts institutions
phonetic: /ˈdiːpən ðə rɪˈfɔrm əv ɑrts ænd pərˈfɔrmɪŋ ɡruːps/
extraExplanation: 这是偏正式、政策文件常用的搭配；在日常英文里会显得“官样”。如果写更自然的英文，可以改为：further reform of arts organizations / advance reforms in performing arts companies。
arts and performing groups 通常指艺术团体、演出团体（如剧院、歌舞团、交响乐团等）；中文语境里也常对应“文艺院团”。
deepen 在这里是比喻用法，表示“更深入、更有力度地推进”，不是字面“变深”。
etymology: 多见于政策/公文语体，是对中文表达“深化……改革”的直译式英语：deepen（加深、推进）+ reform（改革）+ of（……的）。在自然英语中也可说 push forward/advance/further the reform。
mnemonic: 把 deepen reform 记成“把改革挖得更深、更彻底”：deepen=更深入；reform=改革。
performing groups 可以联想“表演(performance)的团队(groups)”→ 演出团体。

word: deepen the reforms of the state asset management system and state-owned enterprises

summary.en: Further advance structural reforms to the governance of public assets and state-owned companies.
summary.zh: 进一步推进国有资产治理与国企改革。

definition.en: To further advance and improve (make more thorough and effective) reforms in how government-owned assets are managed and how state-owned companies operate.
definition.zh: 进一步推进并完善国有资产管理体制和国有企业改革，使改革更深入、更系统、更有效。

examples.en: The government announced measures to deepen the reforms of the state asset management system and state-owned enterprises.
examples.zh: 政府宣布了进一步深化国有资产管理体制和国有企业改革的措施。

examples.en: The plan aims to improve efficiency and accountability as it deepens the reforms of the state asset management system and state-owned enterprises.
examples.zh: 该计划旨在在深化国有资产管理体制和国有企业改革的同时，提高效率与问责。

examples.en: Experts debate how to deepen the reforms of the state asset management system and state-owned enterprises without increasing financial risks.
examples.zh: 专家讨论如何在不增加金融风险的情况下深化国有资产管理体制和国有企业改革。

phonetic: /ˈdiːpən ðə rɪˈfɔrmz əv ðə ˈsteɪt ˈæsəts ˈmænɪdʒmənt ˈsɪstəm ænd ˌsteɪt ˈoʊnd ˈɛntərˌpraɪzɪz/
extraExplanation: 语体与场景：常见于政府报告、政策文件、新闻报道与学术讨论，口语中通常会简化表达。
含义重点：deepen reforms 不只是“继续改革”，更强调“改革走向深层结构与制度层面”，例如治理结构、监督机制、资本运营、混合所有制、绩效与问责等。
搭配提示：英文里更常见的写法包括 “deepen reform of the state-owned assets management system and SOEs” 或 “further deepen reforms of …”。在国际英文中，“state-owned assets”也常用（assets 多于 asset）。
etymology: 这是典型的政策/公文表达：deepen（深化）+ reforms（改革）+ of…（……的）。“state asset(s)”指国有资产，“management system”指管理体制；“state-owned enterprises”常简称 SOEs。
mnemonic: deepen = “深” + “进” → 让改革“更深一层”。看到 deep（深）就联想到“深化”。
SOEs = State-Owned Enterprises，可联想中文“国企”的拼音首字母（Guo企不对，但记作“国企=SOE”固定搭配）。

summary.en: “Deepened” means “made deeper” or “became deeper,” often used for feelings, understanding, problems, or physical depth.
summary.zh: “deepened”表示“使变深/加深”或“变得更深”，常用于情感、理解、问题或物理深度。

definition.en: (Past tense / past participle of “deepen”) Made something deeper in a physical, emotional, or abstract sense; caused it to become stronger or more intense.
definition.zh: （deepen 的过去式/过去分词）使……更深（可指物理深度、情感、理解或程度）；使……加深、加剧。

examples.en: The rain deepened the puddles along the road.
examples.zh: 雨水使路边的水坑变得更深。

examples.en: Talking openly deepened their friendship.
examples.zh: 坦诚交谈加深了他们的友谊。

examples.en: The new evidence deepened the mystery.
examples.zh: 新的证据让谜团更深了。

definition.en: (Past tense / past participle of “deepen”) Became deeper or more intense.
definition.zh: （deepen 的过去式/过去分词）变得更深；加深、加剧。

examples.en: As winter arrived, the snow deepened overnight.
examples.zh: 冬天一到，积雪一夜之间变厚（更深）了。

examples.en: Her voice deepened as she grew older.
examples.zh: 随着年龄增长，她的声音变得更低沉了。

extraExplanation: “deepened”常用于抽象名词：understanding（理解）, relationship（关系）, conflict（冲突）, crisis（危机）, concern（担忧）, divide（分歧）等，表示程度加深/恶化。
在写作中常见搭配：deepened + understanding/relationship/mystery；或 sth deepened（事态加剧/加深）。

summary.en: Deepener means something (or someone) that makes something deeper, stronger, or darker—literally or figuratively.
summary.zh: deepener 指使某物变得更深、更强或更暗（可字面也可比喻）的事物或人。

definition.en: A thing or person that makes something deeper, stronger, or more intense (in a literal or figurative sense).
definition.zh: 使某物更深、更强或更浓（字面或比喻意义上）的事物或人。

examples.en: The crisis became a deepener of public distrust in the government.
examples.zh: 这场危机成了公众对政府不信任加深的推手。

examples.en: Regular reflection can be a deepener of your understanding.
examples.zh: 经常反思可以加深你的理解。

definition.en: (In food, cosmetics, or dyes) An ingredient that deepens color, flavor, or tone.
definition.zh: （用于食品、化妆品或染料）使颜色、风味或色调加深的添加成分。

examples.en: Cocoa powder acts as a color deepener in many baked goods.
examples.zh: 在许多烘焙食品中，可可粉起到加深颜色的作用。

examples.en: The recipe calls for a sauce deepener to make the stew look darker and richer.
examples.zh: 这份食谱需要加入“酱色加深剂”，让炖菜看起来更深更浓。

extraExplanation: “deepener”由动词“deepen（使变深/加深）+ -er（做……的人/物）”构成，意思就是“使……加深的人或东西”。在正式写作里更常见的替代词有“intensifier（强化剂/增强因素）”“darkening agent（增黑/加深剂）”。

summary.en: “Deepeners” means things or factors that deepen or intensify something; it can also mean ingredients that deepen color or flavor.
summary.zh: “Deepeners”指让某事更深或更强烈的因素/事物；也可指用来加深颜色或增强味道的成分。

definition.en: people or things that make something deeper, stronger, or more intense (plural of deepener)
definition.zh: 使某事更“深”、更强或更浓烈的人或事物（deepener 的复数）

examples.en: Good questions can be deepeners—they push the discussion beyond small talk.
examples.zh: 好的问题可以成为“深化剂”——它们能把讨论从寒暄推进到更深入的层面。

examples.en: Increased trust was one of the deepeners of their friendship.
examples.zh: 信任增加是加深他们友谊的因素之一。

definition.en: ingredients or additives used to deepen color or flavor
definition.zh: 用于加深颜色或增强味道的成分/添加剂

examples.en: The recipe suggests soy sauce as one of the flavor deepeners.
examples.zh: 这道食谱建议用酱油作为“增味加深”的调味之一。

examples.en: Caramel can act as a color deepener in some drinks.
examples.zh: 焦糖在某些饮料中可以起到加深颜色的作用。

extraExplanation: “deepener”是由形容词/动词 deep 加上后缀 -en（使变……）再加 -er（……的人/物）构成，字面意思就是“使变深的人/物”。因此 deepeners 常用于比喻：让情感、讨论、关系、味道等“更深更浓”的因素。

summary.en: “Deepening” describes something that is becoming deeper or more intense, or the process of making it so.
summary.zh: “deepening”表示某事正在变得更深/更强烈，或指“加深/加剧”的过程。

definition.en: becoming deeper, stronger, or more intense over time
definition.zh: 逐渐变得更深、更强或更强烈

examples.en: The friendship is deepening as they spend more time together.
examples.zh: 随着他们相处的时间变多，这段友谊正在加深。

examples.en: There are deepening concerns about the economy.
examples.zh: 人们对经济的担忧正在加剧。

definition.en: the process of making something deeper, stronger, or more intense
definition.zh: 加深、加剧或深化的过程

examples.en: The deepening of the river channel helped larger ships enter the port.
examples.zh: 河道的加深帮助更大的船只进入港口。

examples.en: Her deepening interest in literature led her to read novels every night.
examples.zh: 她对文学兴趣的加深让她每晚都读小说。

definition.en: present participle of “deepen”: to make or become deeper, stronger, or more intense
definition.zh: “deepen”的现在分词：使……加深/加剧；变得更深/更强烈

examples.en: The teacher is deepening students’ understanding with clear examples.
examples.zh: 老师用清晰的例子在加深学生的理解。

examples.en: Winter is deepening, and the nights are getting longer.
examples.zh: 冬天渐深，夜晚变得更长。

extraExplanation: “deepening”常见于书面语或新闻语体，尤其在“deepening crisis/concerns/divide/inequality（加深的危机/担忧/分裂/不平等）”这类搭配中，用来强调问题在恶化或变得更严重。
也可用于较中性或积极的语境，如“deepening understanding/relationship（加深理解/关系）”，表示发展得更深入、更成熟。

summary.en: Deepeningly means “in an increasingly deep or intense way,” but it’s rare in everyday English.
summary.zh: deepeningly 表示“以越来越深/越来越强烈的方式”，但在日常英语中很少用。

definition.en: In a way that becomes deeper, stronger, or more intense over time; increasingly deeply.
definition.zh: 以逐渐加深、增强或更强烈的方式；越来越深地。

examples.en: They spoke deepeningly about their fears as the night went on.
examples.zh: 随着夜色渐深，他们越来越深入地谈起自己的恐惧。

examples.en: Her voice grew deepeningly calm after the crisis passed.
examples.zh: 危机过去后，她的声音变得越来越沉稳。

extraExplanation: “deepeningly”在现代英语里非常少见，很多母语者也不常用。表达同样意思时，更自然的说法常用：“increasingly”，“more and more”，“ever more deeply”，或“with growing depth/intensity”。
如果你想强调“关系/情感/理解逐渐加深”，常见搭配是：“their relationship deepened”，“understanding deepened”，“feelings grew deeper”。比起把“deepening”硬变成副词，直接用动词结构通常更地道。

summary.en: “Deepens” means becomes (or makes something) deeper, stronger, or more intense.
summary.zh: “deepens”表示变得（或使）更深、更强或更强烈。

definition.en: (of something) to become deeper, stronger, or more intense; or to make something deeper, stronger, or more intense.
definition.zh: （某事物）变得更深、更强或更强烈；或使某事物更深、更强或更强烈。

examples.en: As the water deepens, it becomes harder to walk safely.
examples.zh: 水越来越深时，安全行走就更困难了。

examples.en: Her interest in science deepens every time she does an experiment.
examples.zh: 每次做实验，她对科学的兴趣都会加深。

examples.en: The company deepens its ties with local communities through long-term programs.
examples.zh: 该公司通过长期项目加深与当地社区的联系。

definition.en: (of a color, sound, or expression) to become darker, fuller, or more serious; or to make it so.
definition.zh: （颜色、声音或表情）变得更深、更浓或更严肃；或使其如此。

examples.en: The sky deepens to purple at sunset.
examples.zh: 日落时天空渐渐变成深紫色。

examples.en: His voice deepens when he is nervous.
examples.zh: 他紧张时声音会变低沉。

extraExplanation: “deepens”是动词“deepen”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it deepens）。常见搭配有：deepens a relationship（加深关系）、deepens understanding（加深理解）、deepens a crisis/problem（使危机/问题加剧）、deepens color（加深颜色）。在新闻和写作里，deepens常用来表达“情况变得更严重/更复杂”。

summary.en: “Deeper” means “more deep” (in depth) or “more profound/serious,” and it can also be used as an adverb meaning “to a greater depth/extent.”
summary.zh: “deeper”表示“更深的/更深入的”，也可引申为“更深刻、更严肃”，并可作副词表示“更深地/更深入地”。

definition.en: (Comparative of “deep”) farther down or farther inside; having more depth than something else.
definition.zh: （deep 的比较级）更深的；更深入的；深度更大的。

examples.en: The lake is deeper near the middle.
examples.zh: 湖在中间更深。

examples.en: Dig a little deeper so the plant’s roots can fit.
examples.zh: 再挖深一点，这样植物的根才能放得下。

definition.en: More serious, intense, or thoughtful (about feelings, meaning, or understanding).
definition.zh: （引申）更深刻的；更强烈的；更深入的（指情感、意义或理解）。

examples.en: They had a deeper conversation after dinner.
examples.zh: 晚饭后他们进行了更深入的交谈。

examples.en: This book gave me a deeper understanding of the history.
examples.zh: 这本书让我对这段历史有了更深的理解。

definition.en: At a greater depth or to a greater extent (used with verbs).
definition.zh: （副词）更深地；更深入地（修饰动词）。

examples.en: Breathe deeper and relax your shoulders.
examples.zh: 呼吸更深一些，放松肩膀。

examples.en: The boat moved deeper into the fog.
examples.zh: 船驶入更浓的雾中。

extraExplanation: “deeper”既可以形容“物理上的深”（deeper water/holes），也很常用来形容“抽象上的深”（deeper feelings/meaning/understanding）。在写作或口语中，抽象用法往往更有“思考更深入、更不表面”的感觉。
常见搭配：deeper into（更深入到……之中）、dig deeper（字面“挖更深”；引申“再多想一点/再努力一点/再多掏一点钱”）、deeper voice（更低沉的声音，口语里也常说 “a deeper voice”。）

summary.en: Deepest means “the most deep,” literally (greatest depth) or figuratively (most intense or heartfelt).
summary.zh: deepest 表示“最深的”，既可指实际深度最大，也可指情感或程度上最强烈、最深切。

definition.en: Superlative form of “deep”; at the greatest depth, or the most intense/strong in degree.
definition.zh: “deep”的最高级；最深的；（程度上）最强烈、最深切的。

examples.en: This is the deepest part of the lake, so don’t swim here.
examples.zh: 这是湖里最深的地方，所以不要在这里游泳。

examples.en: She was in her deepest sleep when the phone rang.
examples.zh: 电话响的时候，她睡得最沉。

examples.en: Please accept my deepest apologies.
examples.zh: 请接受我最深切的歉意。

definition.en: Used in fixed phrases to mean a very central/hidden/serious level of something (often emotions, thoughts, or difficulties).
definition.zh: 用于固定搭配，表示事物非常核心、隐藏或严重的层面（常指情感、想法或困境）。

examples.en: Deepest down, he knew he had made a mistake.
examples.zh: 在内心最深处，他知道自己犯了错。

examples.en: They went into the deepest details of the plan.
examples.zh: 他们讨论了计划最细、最深的细节。

extraExplanation: “deepest”是形容词“deep”的最高级，常见结构：the deepest + 名词（the deepest water / the deepest point）。
常见礼貌与正式用法：my/our deepest apologies/condolences/sympathy（最诚挚的道歉/哀悼/慰问）。在英文书信、公告、新闻中很常见。
与“deeper”区别：deeper是比较级（两者/两部分比较更深），deepest是最高级（在三个及以上中最深，或强调到极致）。

summary.en: a cold-blooded, scaly animal like a snake or lizard; also an insult meaning a nasty person
summary.zh: 蛇、蜥蜴等冷血有鳞的动物；也可作侮辱语指卑鄙讨厌的人

definition.en: a cold-blooded vertebrate animal (such as a snake, lizard, turtle, or crocodile) that usually has dry, scaly skin and lays eggs on land
definition.zh: 爬行动物；（如蛇、蜥蜴、龟、鳄鱼等）通常为冷血、皮肤干燥有鳞，多在陆地产卵的脊椎动物

examples.en: Snakes are reptiles, not mammals.
examples.zh: 蛇是爬行动物，不是哺乳动物。

examples.en: Many reptiles bask in the sun to warm their bodies.
examples.zh: 很多爬行动物会晒太阳来让身体变暖。

examples.en: The zoo built a special habitat for desert reptiles.
examples.zh: 动物园为沙漠爬行动物建了一个特殊的栖息地。

definition.en: (informal, insulting) a person seen as cruel, dishonest, or morally unpleasant
definition.zh: （非正式、侮辱）卑鄙的人；冷酷或不诚实、令人厌恶的人

examples.en: He lied to everyone—what a reptile.
examples.zh: 他骗了所有人——真是个卑鄙的人。

examples.en: In the novel, the villain is described as a ‘reptile’ in a fine suit.
examples.zh: 小说里，反派被描写成“穿着体面西装的卑鄙之徒”。

etymology: 源自拉丁语 reptilis，来自 repere（“爬行”）。原义与“爬着移动的动物”有关，后来扩展为动物学分类用语；口语贬义用法来自把人比作“冷血、令人反感的东西”。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：rep-（反复）+ -tile（联想“tail 尾巴”）→“反复用尾巴贴地爬行的动物”→爬行动物。
联想中文“爬”+“行动”→“爬行动物”；reptile 里的 rept- 像“rept/creep（爬行）”。

summary.en: “deepest-sounding” describes something that sounds very low and deep, especially a voice; it can also mean ‘most profound-seeming.’
summary.zh: “deepest-sounding”形容听起来非常低沉的（常指嗓音），也可比喻为“听起来最有深意/最高深的”。

definition.en: (of a voice, instrument, or noise) having the lowest or most bass-like sound; sounding very deep.
definition.zh: （指声音、乐器或噪声）最低沉的；听起来非常深沉的（低音很重的）。

examples.en: He spoke in his deepest-sounding voice to calm the audience.
examples.zh: 他用自己最低沉的声音说话，让观众安静下来。

examples.en: Among the drums, the bass drum is often the deepest-sounding.
examples.zh: 在各种鼓里，低音大鼓通常听起来最低沉。

definition.en: Figuratively: seeming the most serious, thoughtful, or profound (sometimes only in appearance).
definition.zh: （比喻）显得最严肃、最有思想或最“高深”的（有时只是表面上看起来如此）。

examples.en: That comment may be the deepest-sounding, but it doesn’t answer the question.
examples.zh: 那句话听起来最“高深”，但并没有回答问题。

examples.en: She wrote a deepest-sounding line for the opening of her essay.
examples.zh: 她为文章开头写了一句听起来最有深意的话。

extraExplanation: “deepest-sounding”是复合形容词：deepest（最深/最低沉的）+ sounding（听起来……的）。用连字符多见于放在名词前作定语（a deepest-sounding voice）；放在名词后作表语时常不加连字符（His voice sounded deepest / It was the deepest sounding voice）。
在语体上，它比常见说法更“写作化”。口语里更常说：the deepest voice / the lowest-sounding / the most deep-sounding（后两种也可见）。

summary.en: A deepfake is AI-made fake media that looks or sounds real, and it can also mean the act of making such fake media.
summary.zh: deepfake 指用 AI 制作的高度逼真的假视频/假音频/假图像，也可作动词表示“制作深度伪造内容”。

definition.en: a video, audio recording, or image that has been convincingly altered using AI so it appears someone said or did something they did not actually say or do
definition.zh: 用人工智能等技术高度逼真地篡改的视频、音频或图像，使其看起来像某人说了或做了其并未说/做的事情

examples.en: The clip went viral, but it turned out to be a deepfake.
examples.zh: 这段视频疯传，但后来发现是深度伪造的。

examples.en: Deepfakes can be used to spread misinformation during elections.
examples.zh: 深度伪造可能在选举期间被用来传播虚假信息。

examples.en: Some apps can detect whether a photo is a deepfake.
examples.zh: 一些应用可以检测照片是否为深度伪造。

definition.en: to create a deepfake of someone by using AI to manipulate their face, voice, or actions in media
definition.zh: 用人工智能对某人的脸、声音或动作进行合成/篡改，从而制作深度伪造内容

examples.en: Someone deepfaked the actor’s voice to scam fans.
examples.zh: 有人深度伪造了那位演员的声音来诈骗粉丝。

examples.en: It’s illegal in some places to deepfake a person without consent.
examples.zh: 在一些地区，未经同意对他人进行深度伪造是违法的。

extraExplanation: “deepfake”由“deep learning（深度学习）”+“fake（假冒）”组合而来，最初在网络社区中流行，后来成为媒体与法律讨论中的常用词。
在现实语境中，它常与隐私、名誉、诈骗、政治误导等问题相关；谈论时通常会强调“consent（同意）”“verification（核实）”“media literacy（媒体素养）”。
常见搭配：a deepfake video/audio; deepfake detection; deepfake scam; deepfake pornography（常用于讨论非法或侵权内容）。

summary.en: Deepfelt means sincerely and strongly felt, especially about emotions like gratitude or sorrow.
summary.zh: deepfelt 表示“深切的、真诚的（感情）”，常用于感激、同情、悲伤等较正式的表达。

definition.en: Strongly and sincerely felt; coming from deep emotion (often used before a noun).
definition.zh: 深切感受到的；发自内心的（常用于名词前作定语）。

examples.en: Please accept my deepfelt thanks for your help.
examples.zh: 请接受我对你帮助的深切感谢。

examples.en: She wrote a deepfelt apology to her friend.
examples.zh: 她给朋友写了一封发自内心的道歉信。

examples.en: The community shared deepfelt grief after the loss.
examples.zh: 社区在失去亲人后共同表达了深切的悲痛。

extraExplanation: “deepfelt”更常见的标准拼写是“deep-felt”（带连字符）或“deeply felt”（副词+过去分词）。在正式写作里，建议用“deep-felt sympathy / deep-felt gratitude”或“deeply felt sorrow”。
用法提示：多用于表达情感或态度（gratitude 感激、sympathy 同情、regret 遗憾、sorrow 悲伤、apology 道歉等），语气偏正式、庄重。日常口语里也可以用“really heartfelt / truly heartfelt”。

summary.en: Deep-freeze means a very low-temperature freezer, or to freeze something at very low temperatures; figuratively, it can mean to stop something completely for a time.
summary.zh: deep-freeze 可指低温冷冻柜，也可作动词表示深度冷冻；比喻时可表示让事情彻底停滞、进入“冻结期”。

definition.en: a very low-temperature freezer used for storing food for a long time
definition.zh: 深度冷冻柜；低温冷冻室（用于长期保存食物）

examples.en: We keep meat in the deep-freeze to make it last for months.
examples.zh: 我们把肉放在深度冷冻柜里，可以保存好几个月。

examples.en: The deep-freeze is full, so we can’t buy more frozen food today.
examples.zh: 冷冻柜满了，所以今天不能再买更多冷冻食品了。

definition.en: to freeze something very quickly or at a very low temperature (often for long-term storage)
definition.zh: 深度冷冻；快速冷冻（常指用于长期保存）

examples.en: Deepfreeze the soup in small containers so it’s easy to reheat later.
examples.zh: 把汤分装在小盒里深度冷冻，之后加热更方便。

examples.en: We deep-froze the berries right after picking them.
examples.zh: 我们一采摘完就把浆果快速冷冻起来。

definition.en: to stop or pause something completely, especially a plan, relationship, or negotiation (figurative)
definition.zh: 使完全停滞；冻结（计划/关系/谈判等，常为比喻用法）

examples.en: The sudden scandal deep-froze the talks between the two sides.
examples.zh: 突如其来的丑闻让双方的谈判完全停摆。

examples.en: Their friendship went into a deep-freeze after the argument.
examples.zh: 争吵之后，他们的友谊陷入了“冷冻期”。

extraExplanation: 拼写与用法：更常见的形式是带连字符的 deep-freeze（名词/动词）。写作中也可见 deep freeze（分开）或 Deepfreeze（合写，多见于品牌名、产品名或非正式写法）。
语感提示：比喻用法常见于新闻与商业语境，强调“彻底停下、长期不动”，语气比一般的 freeze/put on ice 更强。
文化与语境：deep-freeze 最初与家用冷柜普及有关（20世纪中期之后更常见），因此它也带有“存起来以后再用”的隐含意义，比喻时常暗示问题被搁置而不是被解决。

summary.en: Deepfreeze (also “deep freeze”) refers to a deep freezer for long-term food storage, a spell of extreme cold, or the act of freezing something very solid for long keeping.
summary.zh: deepfreeze（也作 deep freeze）可指深度冷冻柜、严寒期，也可作动词表示把东西深度冷冻以便长期保存。

definition.en: a deep freezer; a very cold compartment or appliance used to store food for a long time
definition.zh: （家用/商用）深度冷冻柜；用于长期冷冻保存食物的冷冻室或电器

examples.en: We keep meat in the deepfreeze for the whole month.
examples.zh: 我们把肉放在深冻柜里，能存一整个月。

examples.en: The deepfreeze in the basement is packed with frozen vegetables.
examples.zh: 地下室的深冻柜里塞满了冷冻蔬菜。

definition.en: a period of extremely cold weather (often: a deep freeze)
definition.zh: （常用：a deep freeze）严寒期；极冷的天气时段

examples.en: After a deep freeze, the roads were covered with ice.
examples.zh: 经历一段严寒期后，道路都结冰了。

examples.en: The city prepared shelters before the deep freeze arrived.
examples.zh: 在严寒来临前，这座城市准备了避寒所。

definition.en: to freeze something very hard or for long-term storage; to place it in a deep freezer
definition.zh: 深度冷冻；把（食物等）放入深冻柜中长期冷冻保存

examples.en: You can deepfreeze the soup in small containers.
examples.zh: 你可以把汤分装后深度冷冻。

examples.en: Deepfreeze the berries as soon as you get home.
examples.zh: 一到家就把浆果深度冷冻起来。

extraExplanation: 写法上常见两种：deep freeze（分开写）和 deep-freeze（加连字符）。作名词时更常见 deep freeze；作动词时也常见 deep-freeze / deepfreeze，用来强调“冻得很彻底、适合久存”。
在英美日常生活语境里，deep freeze 常让人联想到囤货、备餐（meal prep）、以及冬季寒潮新闻标题（例如“a deep freeze grips the Midwest”）。

summary.en: “deepfreezed” means deep-frozen at very low temperature; it’s an informal/nonstandard form of “deep-froze/deep-frozen.”
summary.zh: “deepfreezed”表示“深度冷冻的/被深冷冻”，多为非正式或非标准写法，更常见的是“deep-froze / deep-frozen（deep-frozen作形容词）”。

definition.en: (informal, often nonstandard) Put into a deep freezer; frozen very solid at a very low temperature.
definition.zh: （非正式，常见为非标准用法）放进深冷冻柜里冷冻；在很低温度下冻得很硬。

examples.en: I deepfreezed the soup in small containers for quick dinners.
examples.zh: 我把汤分装在小盒里深度冷冻，方便快速做晚餐。

examples.en: The fish was deepfreezed right after it was caught.
examples.zh: 鱼刚捕上来就立刻被深度冷冻了。

definition.en: Frozen very solid; kept at very low temperature (same idea as “deep-frozen”).
definition.zh: 深度冷冻的；在极低温下保存的（同“deep-frozen”）。

examples.en: Deepfreezed berries can work well in smoothies.
examples.zh: 深度冷冻的莓果很适合用来打奶昔。

examples.en: Keep the meat deepfreezed until you’re ready to cook it.
examples.zh: 肉先保持深度冷冻，等你准备做饭时再拿出来。

extraExplanation: “deepfreezed”在英语里不太标准，更常见的写法是：动词用“deep-freeze / deep-froze / deep-frozen”，形容词用“deep-frozen”。在说明书、食品包装上也常见“deep-frozen”。
“deep freeze”也可以作名词，指“深冷冻柜/深冷冻状态”；例如：a deep freeze (冷冻柜).

summary.en: Deepfreezing means freezing at very low temperatures (often quickly) to preserve food or other items for long-term storage.
summary.zh: deepfreezing 指在很低温度下（常常是快速地）冷冻，以便长期保存食物或其他物品。

definition.en: the process of freezing food or other items very quickly and/or at a very low temperature so they can be stored for a long time
definition.zh: （用很低温度、通常快速地）深度冷冻；速冻（以便长期保存）

examples.en: Deepfreezing helps keep vegetables fresh for months.
examples.zh: 深度冷冻可以让蔬菜保鲜好几个月。

examples.en: The factory uses deepfreezing to preserve fish for export.
examples.zh: 这家工厂用深度冷冻来保存鱼类以便出口。

definition.en: freezing something using a deep freezer or an industrial freezer (to preserve it)
definition.zh: 把某物放入深冻柜或工业冷冻设备中进行深度冷冻（以保存）

examples.en: They are deepfreezing the berries right after picking them.
examples.zh: 他们在采摘后立刻把浆果进行深度冷冻。

examples.en: Deepfreezing meat soon after packaging reduces spoilage.
examples.zh: 肉类在包装后尽快深度冷冻能减少变质。

extraExplanation: “deepfreeze / deep-freeze / deep-freezing”在英文里常写成带连字符的形式（deep-freezing），也常见作一个词（deepfreezing）。日常生活中更常说“freeze”或“freeze solid”，在食品工业或冷链语境里更常用“deep-freeze / deepfreezing”。

summary.en: “Deepfroze” is the past tense of “deep-freeze,” meaning to freeze something very hard for long-term storage; it can also mean to stop something figuratively.
summary.zh: deepfroze 是 deep-freeze 的过去式，表示把东西深度冷冻以长期保存；也可比喻使某事停滞。

definition.en: simple past tense of “deep-freeze”: to freeze something very hard/very cold, usually for long-term storage (especially food).
definition.zh: “deep-freeze”的一般过去时：把（东西，尤指食物）深度冷冻、冻得很硬，通常用于长期保存。

examples.en: I deepfroze the soup so we could eat it next week.
examples.zh: 我把汤深度冷冻起来，这样下周还能吃。

examples.en: She deepfroze the extra bread to keep it fresh.
examples.zh: 她把多余的面包深度冷冻起来，以保持新鲜。

definition.en: (informal, figurative) to make something stop or become inactive, as if frozen.
definition.zh: （非正式，比喻）使某事停滞/暂停，仿佛被“冻住”。

examples.en: The sudden budget cut deepfroze the project for months.
examples.zh: 突然的预算削减让项目停摆了好几个月。

examples.en: One mistake deepfroze the whole discussion.
examples.zh: 一个失误让整个讨论一下子冷场了。

extraExplanation: 更常见的拼写是带连字符的 **deep-froze**（过去式），原形是 **deep-freeze**。在正式写作中建议用 **deep-froze**。
相关词：**deep-freeze (v./n.)** 可作动词“深度冷冻”，也可作名词指“冷冻柜/冰柜”（尤其英式英语里更常见）。

summary.en: Deepfrozen means kept very solidly frozen at a very low temperature, especially for long-term food storage.
summary.zh: deepfrozen 指（尤其食物）在很低温度下深度冷冻、冻得很硬，用于长期保存。

definition.en: (of food) frozen very solid at a very low temperature so it can be stored for a long time.
definition.zh: （尤指食物）深度冷冻的；在很低温度下冻得很硬、便于长期保存的。

examples.en: Keep the fish deepfrozen until you’re ready to cook it.
examples.zh: 把鱼一直深度冷冻保存，等要做饭时再拿出来。

examples.en: Deepfrozen vegetables are convenient, but check the best-before date.
examples.zh: 深度冷冻蔬菜很方便，但要看看保质期/最佳食用期。

definition.en: stored in a freezer; kept in a deeply frozen state.
definition.zh: 冷冻保存的；以深度冷冻状态存放的。

examples.en: The restaurant uses deepfrozen berries for smoothies.
examples.zh: 这家餐厅用冷冻保存的莓果来做奶昔。

examples.en: Do not refreeze deepfrozen food after it has thawed.
examples.zh: 深度冷冻的食物解冻后不要再次冷冻。

extraExplanation: “deepfrozen / deep-frozen”常见于包装食品或餐饮语境，强调“冻得很透、适合久存”，比一般的“frozen（冷冻的）”更“深”。在日常美式英语中，人们更常说“deep-frozen”或直接说“frozen”，而“deepfreeze”也常作名词/动词（deep freeze）表示“深度冷冻/把……冷得很透”。

summary.en: Deepgoing means either “profound and far-reaching” or (for ships) “able to travel in deep water on long ocean voyages.”
summary.zh: deepgoing 可指“深刻、影响深远的”，也可指（船只）“远洋/深水航行的”。

definition.en: (of thoughts, feelings, or effects) profound; far-reaching; going into great depth.
definition.zh: （思想、感情或影响）深刻的；影响深远的；深入本质的。

examples.en: Her book offers a deepgoing analysis of modern society.
examples.zh: 她的书对现代社会做出了深刻的分析。

examples.en: The conversation became deepgoing after they started talking about family and loss.
examples.zh: 当他们开始谈论家庭与失去时，谈话变得很深入。

definition.en: (of a ship) designed for travel in deep water and long ocean voyages; ocean-going.
definition.zh: （船只）适于深水航行的；远洋的。

examples.en: The port can handle deepgoing vessels used for international trade.
examples.zh: 这个港口能停靠用于国际贸易的远洋船只。

examples.en: They switched from river boats to deepgoing ships for the crossing.
examples.zh: 为了穿越海洋，他们从内河船改用远洋船。

extraExplanation: “deepgoing”也常写作“deep-going”（更常见），意思不变：既可指“深刻/深入”，也可用于航运语境表示“远洋/深水航行的”。
在航运英语里，你也会看到更常用的同义表达：ocean-going（远洋的）、deep-sea（深海的/远洋的）、seagoing（海上航行的）。

summary.en: Deephaven is a proper name most commonly referring to a real-time data analytics and visualization platform.
summary.zh: Deephaven 多指一个用于实时数据分析与可视化的平台（专有名词）。

definition.en: a real-time data analytics and visualization platform (also the name of the open-source project/company behind it), often used to analyze streaming or rapidly changing data.
definition.zh: Deephaven：一个实时数据分析与可视化平台（也是其开源项目/公司名称），常用于分析流式数据或快速变化的数据。

examples.en: Our team uses Deephaven to monitor live market data and build quick dashboards.
examples.zh: 我们团队用 Deephaven 监控实时行情数据，并快速搭建仪表盘。

examples.en: Deephaven lets you query data and update charts as new data arrives.
examples.zh: Deephaven 可以在新数据到来时查询数据并同步更新图表。

extraExplanation: Deephaven 通常作为专有名词出现（首字母大写）。在技术语境里，它更像“产品名/平台名”，所以一般不翻译，直接写 Deephaven。
如果你是在读技术文档，常见搭配包括：Deephaven Community Core（开源核心版）、real-time analytics（实时分析）、streaming data（流式数据）、dashboard（仪表盘）。

summary.en: “Deeping” is mainly used as a place name in England (and sometimes as a surname), not a common everyday word.
summary.zh: “Deeping”主要用作英国地名（有时也作姓氏），不是常见的日常普通词。

definition.en: a place name (proper noun), used in several towns/villages in England, especially in Lincolnshire (e.g., Market Deeping, Deeping St James).
definition.zh: 地名（专有名词）：英国若干城镇/村庄的名称，尤以英格兰林肯郡一带常见（如 Market Deeping、Deeping St James）。

examples.en: She grew up near Market Deeping in Lincolnshire.
examples.zh: 她在林肯郡的 Market Deeping 附近长大。

examples.en: We drove through the Deeping area on the way to Peterborough.
examples.zh: 我们去彼得伯勒的路上开车经过了 Deeping 一带。

definition.en: a surname (family name).
definition.zh: 姓氏（家族姓）。

examples.en: Mr. Deeping will join the meeting at 3 p.m.
examples.zh: Deeping 先生会在下午三点参加会议。

extraExplanation: “Deeping”在现代英语里不常作为普通词使用，更多见于英国地名或姓氏。
如果你本来想写的是动词/名词“deepening”（变深；加深；深化），拼写是 deepening。两者发音和拼写相近，但含义与用法不同。
地名里的“Deeping”常被认为与古英语中表示“深处/深水/深谷”的词源有关，因此常出现在河流、沼泽或地势较低的区域名称中。

summary.en: “Deeping” is a rare form meaning “deepening” (becoming deeper). In modern English, “deepening” is the standard choice.
summary.zh: “deeping”是很少见的形式，意思接近“deepening”（变深/加深）。现代英语通常用“deepening”。

definition.en: becoming deeper; making something deeper (rare; usually written as “deepening”).
definition.zh: 变得更深；使……更深（较少用；通常写作“deepening”）。

examples.en: As winter came, the deeping snow made travel difficult. (rare)
examples.zh: 随着冬天到来，逐渐加深的积雪让出行变得困难。（少见用法）

examples.en: There was a deeping silence in the room before anyone spoke. (rare)
examples.zh: 在有人开口前，房间里出现了越来越深的沉默。（少见用法）

definition.en: the act or process of becoming deeper (very rare; usually “deepening”).
definition.zh: 加深的过程；变深这一变化（非常少见；通常用“deepening”）。

examples.en: The deeping of the river channel changed the shoreline. (very rare)
examples.zh: 河道的加深改变了岸线。（非常少见用法）

extraExplanation: “deeping”在现代英语里非常不常见，很多时候是把“deepening”（加深、变深）拼错了，或是较旧/文学化的用法。
日常写作更推荐用：deepening conflict（冲突加剧）、deepening water（水更深）、deepening understanding（理解加深）。

summary.en: “Deepish” means “somewhat deep,” and informally it can also mean “somewhat profound/serious.”
summary.zh: “deepish”表示“有点深／挺深的”，口语中也可指“有点有深度／有点严肃的”。

definition.en: Somewhat deep; fairly deep (but not extremely deep).
definition.zh: 有点深的；算是挺深的（但不是非常深）。

examples.en: The water is deepish here, so watch your step.
examples.zh: 这里的水有点深，所以走路要小心。

examples.en: We dug a deepish hole for the fence post.
examples.zh: 我们挖了一个挺深的洞来埋栅栏柱。

definition.en: (Informal) Somewhat serious, thoughtful, or “profound,” but not extremely so.
definition.zh: （非正式）有点严肃／有点有深度的（但不算特别深刻）。

examples.en: It was a deepish conversation about family and work.
examples.zh: 那是一段有点走心的谈话，聊到家庭和工作。

examples.en: The movie has a deepish message, but it’s still easy to watch.
examples.zh: 这部电影的主题有点深度，但依然很好看。

extraExplanation: “deepish”是口语/非正式用法，常见于日常对话和写作中。后缀“-ish”表示“有点……、大概……”，语气更随意、更不精确：deep → deepish（有点深），也类似 tallish（有点高）、greenish（有点发绿）。
在语气上，“deepish”通常比“deep”更温和，暗示说话者觉得“差不多是深的”，但不想下非常确定或夸张的判断。

summary.en: “Deeplier” is a nonstandard form intended to mean “more deeply.” Use “more deeply” (adverb) or “deeper” (adjective).
summary.zh: “deeplier”是非标准用法，想表达“更深地”。标准写法用“more deeply”（副词）或“deeper”（形容词）。

definition.en: Nonstandard or incorrect form used to mean “more deeply.” In standard English, people usually say “more deeply,” or use “deeper” when it modifies a noun.
definition.zh: 非标准或不正确的写法/用法，用来表示“更深地”。标准英语一般说“more deeply”；修饰名词时通常用“deeper（更深的）”。

examples.en: Nonstandard: Try to think deeplier about the problem. (Better: Try to think more deeply about the problem.)
examples.zh: 非标准：Try to think deeplier about the problem.（更好：Try to think more deeply about the problem.）

examples.en: We need to look more deeply into the causes. (Not: deeplier)
examples.zh: 我们需要更深入地调查原因。（不建议：deeplier）

examples.en: This conversation has a deeper meaning. (Adjective before a noun.)
examples.zh: 这段对话有更深层的含义。（名词前用形容词 deeper）

extraExplanation: “deeply”是副词，本身没有常用的比较级“deeplier”。标准表达通常是“more deeply”。
形容词“deep”的比较级是“deeper”，多用于修饰名词：a deeper understanding（更深的理解）。
在口语或非正式写作中偶尔会看到“deeplier”，但在考试、论文、简历等正式场合应避免使用。

summary.en: Deeply means “very strongly/seriously,” especially about emotions or effects; less commonly, it means “far down/inside.”
summary.zh: deeply 多指“深深地、强烈地、深刻地”（常用于情感或影响），较少指“在很深处/很深地”。

definition.en: In a deep or serious way; strongly and intensely (about feelings, thoughts, or influence).
definition.zh: 深深地；深刻地；强烈地（常指感情、想法或影响的程度很深）。

examples.en: I’m deeply sorry for your loss.
examples.zh: 我为你的失去深感抱歉。

examples.en: She was deeply moved by the story.
examples.zh: 她被这个故事深深打动了。

examples.en: This decision will deeply affect our future.
examples.zh: 这个决定将深刻地影响我们的未来。

definition.en: Far down or far inside (less common; often used with verbs like breathe/dive).
definition.zh: 在很深处；很深地（较少见；常与 breathe/dive 等动词搭配）。

examples.en: Breathe deeply and try to relax.
examples.zh: 深呼吸，尽量放松。

examples.en: The roots grow deeply into the soil.
examples.zh: 根深深扎进土壤里。

extraExplanation: “deeply”常用来表达情绪或态度的“程度很深”，语气比“very”更正式、更有分量：deeply grateful（万分感激）、deeply concerned（深切担忧）。
注意搭配：deeply + 过去分词/形容词 很常见（deeply shocked/moved/affected），而表示“很深”这一空间含义时，经常用在动作之后或与动作动词搭配（breathe deeply, dive deeply）。

summary.en: “Deepmost” means “the deepest” or “the innermost,” used mostly in descriptive or literary style.
summary.zh: deepmost 意为“最深的/最里面的”，多用于描写性或文学语境。

definition.en: The deepest; farthest down or farthest inside (often describing a place, layer, or part).
definition.zh: 最深的；最里面的（常指位置、层次或部分）。

examples.en: In the deepmost part of the cave, the air was cold and still.
examples.zh: 在洞穴最深处，空气又冷又静。

examples.en: The roots reach the deepmost layers of the soil for water.
examples.zh: 根系延伸到土壤最深层去吸水。

definition.en: (Figurative, less common) The most profound or hidden (about feelings, thoughts, or meanings).
definition.zh: （比喻，较少见）最深刻的；最隐秘的（指感情、想法或含义）。

examples.en: She kept her deepmost fears to herself.
examples.zh: 她把最深的恐惧藏在心里。

examples.en: The poem hints at the deepmost meaning behind ordinary words.
examples.zh: 这首诗暗示了普通词语背后的最深层含义。

extraExplanation: “deepmost”在现代英语里比较少见，更常用的是“deepest”或“innermost”。它带有一点文学/描写性的语气，常用于强调“最深处/最深层”的画面感。

summary.en: Deep-mouthed means deep-voiced and loud, often in literary language; it’s also used for hounds with deep baying voices.
summary.zh: deep-mouthed 指声音低沉而洪亮（常见于文学/古典表达）；也可指猎犬等吠声低沉。

definition.en: Having a deep, loud voice or sound; deep-voiced (often used in literary or old-fashioned writing).
definition.zh: （多用于文学或较古旧的表达）声音低沉而洪亮的；低音的。

examples.en: The deep-mouthed bell echoed across the valley.
examples.zh: 那口低沉洪亮的钟声在山谷间回荡。

examples.en: A deep-mouthed singer led the chorus with a steady bass line.
examples.zh: 一位嗓音低沉的歌手用稳定的低音带领合唱。

definition.en: (Of a dog, especially a hound) Having a deep baying voice.
definition.zh: （尤指猎犬）吠声低沉的；嗥叫声浑厚的。

examples.en: Deep-mouthed hounds could be heard long before they came into view.
examples.zh: 那些吠声低沉的猎犬在出现之前很久就能听见。

examples.en: The hunter preferred deep-mouthed dogs for tracking in thick woods.
examples.zh: 猎人更喜欢吠声低沉的狗来在密林里追踪。

extraExplanation: 这是由 deep（深的、低沉的）+ mouthed（有……口/嗓音的）构成的复合形容词，常见于诗歌或较古典的描写。
在文学中它不是真的指“嘴巴很深”，而是借“mouth（口、嗓子）”来形容声音的音色与响度。
常见搭配包括 deep-mouthed bell（低沉的钟声）、deep-mouthed hounds（吠声低沉的猎犬）。

summary.en: Deepness means the state of being deep, either physically (depth) or in meaning (profoundness).
summary.zh: Deepness 指“深”的状态，可指物理上的深度，也可指意义上的深刻。

definition.en: the quality or state of being deep (distance from the surface down, or from the front/back inward)
definition.zh: 深度；深邃（指从表面向下或向内的距离）

examples.en: The deepness of the well made it hard to hear anyone at the bottom.
examples.zh: 井的深度很大，让人很难听到井底的人说话。

examples.en: They measured the deepness of the snow before hiking.
examples.zh: 他们在徒步前测量了积雪的深度。

definition.en: the quality of being emotionally or intellectually profound; seriousness or richness of meaning
definition.zh: 深刻；内涵丰富（指情感或思想上的深度）

examples.en: I like the deepness of her writing—every sentence feels meaningful.
examples.zh: 我喜欢她文字的深刻——每一句都很有意义。

examples.en: The film has an unexpected deepness that stays with you.
examples.zh: 这部电影有一种出乎意料的深刻感，让人久久难忘。

extraExplanation: “deepness”是可用的名词，但在现代英语里更常用、更自然的说法通常是“depth”。例如：the depth of the ocean（海洋的深度）、the depth of his feelings（他感情的深度）。
在表达“思想/情感深刻”时，英语里也常用“depth”“profoundness”或直接用形容词“deep”：a deep conversation（一次很深入的谈话）。

summary.en: “Deepnesses” means “depths” or “multiple kinds of deepness,” but it’s uncommon in everyday English.
summary.zh: “deepnesses”指“深处/多重深度”，但在日常英语中不常用，通常用“depths”。

definition.en: plural of deepness: the state or quality of being deep (physical depth or figurative intensity).
definition.zh: deepness 的复数：深的状态或性质（可指空间深度，也可指抽象上的深刻、强烈）。

examples.en: The diver explored the deepnesses of the sea canyon.
examples.zh: 潜水员探索了海底峡谷的深处。

examples.en: In her poems, he admired the deepnesses of her emotion.
examples.zh: 在她的诗里，他欣赏她情感的深刻与浓烈。

extraExplanation: “deepnesses”比较少见；更自然、更常用的说法通常是“depths”（深处/深度）或“the depth of …”（……的深度/深刻）。在文学或强调“多层次的深”时，作者可能会用复数 deepnesses 来营造氛围或突出“多重深处/多种深度”。

summary.en: “Deeps” means the deepest parts of something, especially the ocean; it can also be used poetically for a deep, mysterious state.
summary.zh: “deeps”指某物最深的部分（尤指海洋深处）；也可用于文学表达，指幽深、神秘的境地或状态。

definition.en: the deepest parts of something (especially the ocean); depths
definition.zh: （尤指海洋的）深处；深海；深渊；深度（depths 的另一种说法）

examples.en: Deep-sea creatures live in the deeps of the ocean.
examples.zh: 深海生物生活在海洋的深处。

examples.en: The diver disappeared into the deeps.
examples.zh: 潜水员消失在深处。

examples.en: In winter, the lake freezes on top, but the deeps stay dark and cold.
examples.zh: 冬天湖面结冰，但湖的深处依然又黑又冷。

definition.en: (poetic/literary) a very deep, mysterious, or hard-to-understand place or state
definition.zh: （诗歌/文学用法）幽深之地；深不可测的境地（常带神秘或难以理解的意味）

examples.en: He felt pulled into the deeps of grief.
examples.zh: 他感觉自己被悲伤的深处吞没。

examples.en: The novel explores the deeps of human nature.
examples.zh: 这部小说探讨了人性的幽深之处。

extraExplanation: “the deeps”常见于文学、诗歌或较有画面感的表达中，比普通的“depths”更强调广阔、幽暗、神秘的意象，尤其让人联想到深海或深渊。
相关表达：the deep（深海/海洋）；the depths（深处/内心深处）；deep waters（困境；深水区）。

summary.en: “Deepsome” is not standard English; it’s likely a typo or a name/creative spelling.
summary.zh: “deepsome”不是标准英语词；更可能是拼写错误或专名/创意拼写。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is most likely a typo or a creative/brand spelling (for example, you may have meant “deep” + something, or “deep-sea,” “deepsome” is not found in common dictionaries).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词。它很可能是拼写错误或创意/品牌拼写（例如你可能想写“deep”+某个词，或“deep-sea”等；常见词典里一般找不到“deepsome”。

examples.en: I can’t find “deepsome” in a dictionary—did you mean “deep-sea” or “deep some”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“deepsome”——你是不是想写“deep-sea（深海的）”或“deep some（把某些东西挖深/加深）”？

examples.en: If you share the full sentence, I can help you identify the intended word.
examples.zh: 如果你把完整句子发给我，我可以帮你判断你想表达的词。

extraExplanation:
“deepsome”可能出现于：
1）拼写/自动纠错导致的错误（比如把两个词连在一起）；
2）用户名、品牌名、网名等专有写法；
3）非母语者造词。

如果你告诉我它出现的语境（整句或上下文、你想表达的中文意思），我可以给出最接近的正确英文以及用法对比。

summary.en: Deepwater means very deep water, especially offshore or far from land, and it can be used as an adjective or a noun.
summary.zh: Deepwater 指“深水（的）”，尤指远离海岸的深水区域，可作形容词或名词使用。

definition.en: (of the sea or an area of water) very deep, especially far from the shore; often used in offshore industry contexts.
definition.zh: （海或水域）深水的；尤指远离海岸、常用于海上（离岸）工业语境。

examples.en: The company operates deepwater oil platforms in the Gulf of Mexico.
examples.zh: 这家公司在墨西哥湾运营深水采油平台。

examples.en: Deepwater currents can carry nutrients across the ocean.
examples.zh: 深水洋流可以把营养物质带到海洋各处。

definition.en: deep water as a place or condition, especially in the open sea or far from land.
definition.zh: 深水水域；（尤指）远海、离岸很远的深水区域。

examples.en: The small boat avoided deepwater and stayed close to the coast.
examples.zh: 小船避开深水区，沿着海岸行驶。

examples.en: Some fish migrate to deepwater during the day.
examples.zh: 有些鱼白天会迁移到深水区。

extraExplanation: “deepwater”常见于新闻与能源行业搭配，如 deepwater drilling（深水钻探）、deepwater horizon（深水地平线；也让人联想到2010年“深水地平线”漏油事件 Deepwater Horizon oil spill）。在日常口语里，人们更常说 deep water（深水）。

summary.en: Deepwater refers to water deep enough for large ships, or to deep/open water far from shore.
summary.zh: deepwater 指“适合大型船舶通行的深水（港口/航道）”，也可指“远离海岸的深水海域”。

definition.en: (Of a place or facility) having water that is deep enough for large ships; suitable for navigation by large vessels.
definition.zh: （地点或设施）深水的；水深足以让大型船只通行的。

examples.en: The city built a deepwater port to attract more international trade.
examples.zh: 这座城市修建了一个深水港，以吸引更多国际贸易。

examples.en: Deepwater channels allow cargo ships to reach the terminal safely.
examples.zh: 深水航道让货轮能够安全抵达码头。

definition.en: Deep water, especially far from shore or in the open ocean.
definition.zh: 深水（水域）；尤指远离海岸的外海深水。

examples.en: The divers moved from the reef into deepwater.
examples.zh: 潜水员从礁石区进入深水区。

examples.en: Oil exploration in deepwater is expensive and risky.
examples.zh: 在深水海域进行石油勘探成本高、风险大。

extraExplanation: “Deepwater”常见于海运与能源领域：deepwater port（深水港）、deepwater drilling（深水钻探）。
它也常被用作专有名词的一部分，如“Deepwater Horizon”（深水地平线），是2010年墨西哥湾重大漏油事故相关的钻井平台名称。作为普通词汇时不特指该事件。

summary.en: A rare term for a man associated with deep water (deep-sea or offshore work).
summary.zh: 一个较少见的词，指与深水海域相关的男人（深海或离岸工作者）。

definition.en: (rare) A man who works on or is associated with deep water, especially in deep-sea fishing, offshore work, or deep-water navigation.
definition.zh: （罕见）与深水海域有关的男人，尤指从事深海捕鱼、海上油气/海工等离岸工作或深水航行的人。

examples.en: The novel describes him as a deepwaterman who spent months at sea.
examples.zh: 小说把他写成一位常年出海、一走就是几个月的“深水人/深海汉子”。

examples.en: Deepwatermen in the Gulf often work long shifts on offshore platforms.
examples.zh: 墨西哥湾的“深水工人”常常在海上平台上轮班长时间工作。

extraExplanation: “deepwaterman”不是常见标准词，更常见的写法是分开或加连字符：deep-water man / deepwater man。很多情况下它也可能是人名、网名或用户名，需要结合上下文判断。
如果你是在某篇文章/歌词/游戏里看到它，发我原句，我可以更准确判断是指“离岸工人”“深海渔民”，还是专有名词（如昵称、角色名等）。

summary.en: Deepwatermen are people who work and fish in deep, offshore waters.
summary.zh: deepwatermen 指在深水外海作业、捕鱼等的水上劳动者（复数）。

definition.en: people (especially fishermen or boat workers) who work far from shore in deep water; deep-sea/ offshore watermen
definition.zh: 在近海以外的深水海域工作的人（尤指渔民或船上作业者）；远海/外海水上劳作者

examples.en: The deepwatermen headed out before sunrise to check their nets.
examples.zh: 这些外海作业的渔民在日出前就出发去查看渔网。

examples.en: Storm warnings kept many deepwatermen in port that week.
examples.zh: 那周的风暴警报让许多外海作业者不得不留在港里。

extraExplanation: “deepwatermen”是复数形式，单数常见为“deepwaterman”。在美国大西洋沿岸（尤其切萨皮克湾地区），waterman/ watermen 是很有地方特色的称呼，指以捕蟹、挖牡蛎、捕鱼等为生的水上劳动者；“deepwatermen”强调他们在更深、更远离岸的水域作业。

summary.en: A deer is a wild hoofed animal; plural is usually the same form: deer.
summary.zh: deer 指“鹿”；复数通常不变，仍是 deer。

definition.en: a wild animal with long legs; the male often has antlers (branching horns).
definition.zh: 鹿；一种野生动物，腿长；雄鹿通常长有鹿角（分叉的角）。

examples.en: We saw a deer in the forest at sunrise.
examples.zh: 我们在日出时在森林里看到了一只鹿。

examples.en: A male deer is often called a buck, and a female is a doe.
examples.zh: 雄鹿常叫 buck，雌鹿叫 doe。

definition.en: deer as a group (the plural form is usually the same: deer).
definition.zh: 鹿类（作集合名词；复数通常与单数同形：deer）。

examples.en: Many deer live in this park.
examples.zh: 这个公园里住着许多鹿。

extraExplanation: 语法提示：deer 的单复数同形（one deer / two deer）。想更明确也可以说 “two deer” 或 “a herd of deer（鹿群）”。
文化/文学中：deer 常象征温柔、敏捷、自然与野性；在北美语境中也常出现在野生动物保护、交通标志（deer crossing）等场景。

summary.en: “Deer-like” means resembling a deer, often suggesting grace, slenderness, or being easily startled.
summary.zh: “deer-like”指“像鹿的”，常暗示优雅、纤细，或容易受惊。

definition.en: Resembling a deer in appearance or behavior (for example, slender, graceful, shy, with deer-like eyes).
definition.zh: 像鹿的；具有鹿的外形或气质（例如：纤细、优雅、胆怯、长着“鹿一般的眼睛”）。

examples.en: She moved with a deer-like grace across the stage.
examples.zh: 她走过舞台时带着鹿一般的优雅。

examples.en: The child had big, deer-like eyes.
examples.zh: 那个孩子有一双又大又像小鹿般的眼睛。

examples.en: At the slightest noise, he had a deer-like startle response.
examples.zh: 稍微有点响动，他就像鹿一样受惊。

extraExplanation: “deer-like”是由名词deer（鹿）+ 后缀-like（像……一样）构成的形容词。英语里常见这种结构：childlike（像孩子般天真）、catlike（像猫般敏捷）、businesslike（做事很“公事公办”）。
在描写人物时，“deer-like eyes / deer-like grace”多用于文学或抒情表达，强调温柔、清澈、脆弱或优雅；但在“deer-like panic/startle”里也可强调容易受惊、紧张。

summary.en: A “deer-pig” is another name for the babirusa, an Indonesian wild pig with tusks that can resemble antlers.
summary.zh: “deer-pig（鹿猪）”是 babirusa（巴比鲁萨/鹿猪）的别称，指一种印度尼西亚的野猪，獠牙外形有时像鹿角。

definition.en: a babirusa: a wild pig from Indonesia, sometimes called a “deer-pig” because it has long, curved tusks that can look like antlers.
definition.zh: 鹿猪：印度尼西亚的一种野猪，因其又长又弯的獠牙有点像鹿角而得名。

examples.en: The babirusa is sometimes nicknamed a deer-pig because its tusks curve upward.
examples.zh: 巴比鲁萨（babirusa）有时被昵称为“鹿猪”，因为它的獠牙向上弯曲。

examples.en: At the zoo, we learned that the deer-pig comes from islands in Indonesia.
examples.zh: 在动物园里，我们了解到鹿猪来自印度尼西亚的一些岛屿。

extraExplanation: “deer-pig”不是非常常见的日常英语词，更常见、也更标准的名称是 babirusa。它的雄性上犬齿会穿过上唇继续生长，弯成弧形，看起来有点像“鹿角”，因此英语里会出现这种形象化的叫法。

summary.en: “Deer-pigs” usually refers to babirusas (wild pigs) and sometimes is an older informal term for tiny deer-like animals.
summary.zh: “deer-pigs”通常指巴比鲁萨（鹿猪，一种野猪）；有时也作较旧的非正式称呼，指体型很小的“像鹿的动物”。

definition.en: (Plural) animals called deer-pigs—pig-like mammals sometimes described as “deer-like” because of their slim legs or appearance; the term is most often used for the babirusa in Indonesia.
definition.zh: （复数）“鹿猪”（deer-pigs）——一种外形像猪、但因体态或四肢较修长而被形容为“像鹿”的动物；这个称呼最常见指印度尼西亚的巴比鲁萨（babirusa）。

examples.en: Deer-pigs live on Indonesian islands such as Sulawesi.
examples.zh: 鹿猪生活在印度尼西亚的一些岛屿上，比如苏拉威西岛。

examples.en: The zoo’s sign explained that deer-pigs are wild pigs with unusual tusks.
examples.zh: 动物园的牌子说明：鹿猪是一种长着奇特獠牙的野猪。

definition.en: (Less common) a loose, non-scientific label for very small deer-like animals (such as mouse-deer/chevrotains) in older or informal writing.
definition.zh: （较不常见）在较旧或非正式的文字中，对一些体型很小、外形像鹿的动物（如鼷鹿/鼠鹿，mouse-deer/chevrotains）的笼统称呼。

examples.en: In older travel writing, tiny forest animals were sometimes called deer-pigs.
examples.zh: 在一些较早的游记里，森林中很小的动物有时会被称作“鹿猪”。

extraExplanation: “deer-pig(s)”不是严格的科学分类名，更像是俗称；现代更常用具体名称 babirusa（巴比鲁萨）或 mouse-deer/chevrotain（鼷鹿/鼠鹿）。
babirusa 因上弯的獠牙很有辨识度，所以在英文里更容易被冠以这种带形象比喻的名称。

summary.en: “Deer-related” means connected with deer or caused by deer.
summary.zh: “deer-related”表示“与鹿有关的”或“由鹿导致的”。

definition.en: connected with deer (the animal), or involving deer in some way.
definition.zh: 与鹿（这种动物）有关的；涉及鹿的。

examples.en: The park created a deer-related safety campaign for drivers.
examples.zh: 公园为司机发起了一项与鹿有关的安全宣传活动。

examples.en: Researchers studied deer-related changes in the local ecosystem.
examples.zh: 研究人员研究了与鹿有关的当地生态系统变化。

definition.en: caused by deer, or happening because of deer.
definition.zh: 由鹿造成的；因鹿而发生的。

examples.en: Farmers reported deer-related damage to crops.
examples.zh: 农民报告了由鹿造成的农作物损失。

examples.en: The insurance company covers deer-related accidents on this highway.
examples.zh: 这家保险公司承保这条高速公路上因鹿引发的事故。

extraExplanation: “deer-related”是一个常见的复合形容词（deer + related），通常用连字符把两个部分连接起来，表示“与……相关的”。在正式写作里常见连字符；在一些语境中也可能写作“deer related”。
常见搭配：deer-related accident（与鹿有关的交通事故）、deer-related damage（鹿造成的损害）、deer-related research/management（鹿相关研究/管理）。

summary.en: Deer-slaying means killing deer, either as an activity (noun) or describing something related to killing deer (adjective).
summary.zh: deer-slaying 指“猎杀鹿”，既可作名词表示这一行为，也可作形容词描述与猎杀鹿相关的事物。

definition.en: (Of a person, weapon, or activity) involving killing deer; used for hunting deer.
definition.zh: （人、武器或活动）与猎杀鹿有关的；用于猎鹿的。

examples.en: The park banned deer-slaying activities to protect the local herd.
examples.zh: 公园禁止猎杀鹿的活动，以保护当地鹿群。

examples.en: He carried a deer-slaying rifle, but he only planned to photograph wildlife.
examples.zh: 他带着一把猎鹿步枪，但他其实只打算拍摄野生动物。

definition.en: The act or practice of killing deer (often for food, sport, or population control).
definition.zh: 猎杀鹿的行为或做法（常为食物、运动或控制数量）。

examples.en: Deer-slaying was once a common way to provide meat through the winter.
examples.zh: 过去猎杀鹿曾是人们过冬获得肉类的一种常见方式。

examples.en: The novel opens with deer-slaying in the forest to show the harshness of life.
examples.zh: 小说以森林里的猎杀鹿开篇，用来表现生活的艰辛。

extraExplanation: “deer-slaying”是由deer（鹿）+ slaying（杀戮）组成的复合词，常用连字符作定语（deer-slaying season / deer-slaying rifle）。不加连字符时也可能写成“deer slaying”，但作形容词放在名词前时加连字符更清晰。
slay这个词本身带一点文学/史诗色彩（比kill更“戏剧化、古典”），所以“deer-slaying”在新闻或文学描写里更常见；日常中更中性的说法通常是“deer hunting”或“killing deer”。

summary.en: Deerberry is a wild North American shrub related to blueberries, named because deer often eat its berries.
summary.zh: Deerberry（鹿莓）是一种北美野生的越橘属灌木，和蓝莓同科，因常被鹿取食而得名。

definition.en: a North American wild shrub in the blueberry family that produces small berries (often not very sweet) and is eaten by wildlife such as deer
definition.zh: 一种北美野生灌木（越橘/蓝莓家族），结小浆果（常不太甜），常被鹿等野生动物取食

examples.en: We found deerberry growing along the sandy trail in the pine woods.
examples.zh: 我们在松林里沙质的小路旁发现了鹿莓（deerberry）。

examples.en: Deerberry is related to blueberries, but the fruit can taste more tart or bland.
examples.zh: 鹿莓和蓝莓是近亲，但果实味道可能更酸或更淡。

examples.en: Birds and deer help spread deerberry seeds by eating the berries.
examples.zh: 鸟和鹿吃下浆果后会帮助传播鹿莓的种子。

extraExplanation: Deerberry 常指学名 Vaccinium stamineum（越橘属），分布于美国东南部等地，常见于沙地、松林、灌丛边缘。
名字里的 deer-（鹿）来自它常被鹿取食；但人也会采食，只是口感通常不如栽培蓝莓甜。
有些地区对同一种植物使用过带冒犯性的旧俗名；在现代英语里更推荐使用 deerberry 或学名来避免不尊重的表达。

summary.en: Deerbrook is a proper name: most notably the title of an 1839 novel by Harriet Martineau, and also a place name meaning “deer + brook.”
summary.zh: Deerbrook是专有名词：最常见是1839年哈丽雅特·马丁诺小说《Deerbrook》的书名；也可作地名，字面为“鹿 + 小溪”。

definition.en: a proper name used as the title of a novel by Harriet Martineau (published in 1839).
definition.zh: 专有名词：英国作家哈丽雅特·马丁诺（Harriet Martineau）1839年出版的小说《Deerbrook》的书名。

examples.en: I’m reading Harriet Martineau’s Deerbrook for a class on nineteenth-century fiction.
examples.zh: 我正在读哈丽雅特·马丁诺的《Deerbrook》，作为一门十九世纪小说课的阅读。

examples.en: In Deerbrook, everyday village life becomes the setting for moral and social questions.
examples.zh: 在《Deerbrook》中，日常的乡村生活成为探讨道德与社会问题的背景。

definition.en: a place name (especially in the U.S.) used for neighborhoods, roads, or small communities; literally suggesting “a brook (stream) where deer are found.”
definition.zh: 地名（美国较常见）：用于社区、街区或道路名称；字面意思是“有鹿出没的小溪/溪流”。

examples.en: They bought a house in Deerbrook, a quiet suburban neighborhood.
examples.zh: 他们在Deerbrook买了房子，那是个安静的郊区社区。

examples.en: Turn right onto Deerbrook Road and continue for two miles.
examples.zh: 右转上Deerbrook Road，然后继续走两英里。

extraExplanation: 《Deerbrook》作为小说标题时，常被视为维多利亚时代早期的“乡村生活/社会风俗”题材作品之一；作者马丁诺也以社会评论与政治经济写作闻名，因此读者有时会在作品中读到对阶级、名声与道德判断的讨论。

summary.en: “Deerdog” is an uncommon term meaning a dog used for hunting or tracking deer.
summary.zh: “deerdog”是不常见的说法，指用于追踪或猎鹿的狗。

definition.en: (Uncommon) a dog trained or used for hunting deer; a deer-hunting dog.
definition.zh: （不常见）用于追踪或猎鹿的狗；猎鹿犬。

examples.en: He raised a deer dog to track wounded deer in the woods.
examples.zh: 他养了一只猎鹿犬，用来在树林里追踪受伤的鹿。

examples.en: In some rural areas, people still use deer dogs during hunting season.
examples.zh: 在一些乡村地区，人们在狩猎季节仍会使用猎鹿犬。

extraExplanation: “deerdog / deer dog”不是很标准的常用词，更常见的说法是“deer hound（猎鹿犬）”或“deer-hunting dog（猎鹿用的狗）”。
在一些地方（尤其是美国南部等地区）的口语或狩猎语境里，可能会把专门追鹿的狗随口称为“deer dog”。也可能被当作网名、昵称或品牌名使用，此时含义取决于具体语境。

summary.en: Deerdre is a less common spelling of the Irish female name Deirdre.
summary.zh: Deerdre 通常是爱尔兰女性名字 Deirdre 的较少见拼写。

definition.en: A female given name (usually Irish). It is often a misspelling of the more common spelling “Deirdre.”
definition.zh: 女性名字（多见于爱尔兰）。常被视为更常见拼写“Deirdre”的误拼。

examples.en: Deirdre (sometimes spelled Deerdre) is an Irish name.
examples.zh: Deirdre（有时也会拼成 Deerdre）是一个爱尔兰名字。

examples.en: Deerdre put her name on the form, but the system suggested “Deirdre.”
examples.zh: Deerdre 在表格上填了名字，但系统提示可能是“Deirdre”。

extraExplanation: “Deirdre”源自爱尔兰传说人物“Deirdre of the Sorrows（悲伤的迪尔德丽）”，她的故事在爱尔兰文化中很有名，因此这个名字带有传统、神话色彩。现代英语里通常把它当作普通人名使用，并不一定带有“悲伤”的含义。
如果你是在问拼写：更常见、也更标准的拼写是 Deirdre；Deerdre 属于较少见的变体/误拼。

summary.en: “Deer drive” most commonly means a group hunting technique used to push deer toward waiting hunters.
summary.zh: “deer drive”最常见指一种集体狩猎方式：把鹿驱赶到埋伏的猎人方向。

definition.en: a hunting method where people move through an area to push (drive) deer toward other hunters waiting in a set position
definition.zh: （狩猎）“赶鹿围猎”：一组人穿过林地把鹿驱赶到另一组等待的猎人方向

examples.en: They organized a deer drive at dawn to move the herd out of the thick woods.
examples.zh: 他们在黎明组织了一次赶鹿围猎，把鹿群从密林里赶出来。

examples.en: During the deer drive, some hunters stayed still while others walked and made noise to push the deer forward.
examples.zh: 在赶鹿围猎中，有些猎人原地埋伏，另一些人边走边制造声音把鹿往前驱赶。

definition.en: (less common) an organized community event to collect donations or supplies related to deer, such as venison donations or wildlife support
definition.zh: （较少见）与鹿相关的募捐/捐赠活动，例如捐赠鹿肉或支持野生动物项目的活动
